Title: Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
Job Description

Data Analyst (m/f/d)

THIS IS US

At Oetker Digital, we partner with the Oetker Group companies to define what digital business transformation means and to create business value and impact based on data, technology and talents, so that they can unlock their digital future. We support many beloved brands such as Dr. Oetker, Radeberger and Coppenrath & Wiese.

With our team of about 100 talented individuals from diverse backgrounds, based in our Berlin headquarters, we foster an open, positive learning culture, driven by our shared values and the spirit of a family-run company.

THE ROLE We are looking for a talented Data Analyst to join our innovative and international Data & Insights team. By understanding the data needs of our stakeholders, you'll provide valuable insights and clear recommendations to support our data-driven decision-making process.

What You'll Do


Dive into complex marketing data sets to uncover trends and insights that drive key business decisions. Your work will have a direct impact on the strategy and growth of our group companies
Collaborate with a forward-thinking team that embraces the latest technologies and methodologies. We believe in continuous learning and innovation
Partner closely with team members and external business stakeholders to understand their data needs and objectives
Act as a consultant, using probing questions to gain deep insights into the business domain and processes
Communicate insights in a compelling and accessible manner to support data-driven decision-making



Requirements

WHAT YOU'LL BRING


At least 3 years of experience in data analysis or data consulting, preferably within a business context, preferably in Consulting
A Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in a related field (e.g., Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science)
Proficient in SQL and/or Python for data analysis and modeling
Experiences with Marketing Data and Analytics, as well as Retail Media and Customer Analytics would be a big plus
Familiarity with Cloud platforms for data storage and processing, having worked with BigQuery is a plus
Strong abilities in generating reports using data visualization tools such as Power BI or Tableau
A proactive and collaborative mindset, with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to communicate complex ideas clearly
A passion for learning, hands-on work, taking ownership, and making an impact
Fluent in German and English



What We Offer


Modern and dog friendly office located at the heart of Berlin
Hybrid working model with flexible working hours for a healthy work-life balance
We work in cross-functional and international teams and have regular company/team events
28 days of paid vacation, plus Christmas and New Year‚Äôs Eve off, as well as the possibility to take a sabbatical or additional unpaid leave
10 paid child‚Äôs sick days per year
Annual learning and development budget purchase educational resources up to ‚Ç¨1.500
Equipment of your choice: Macbook or Lenovo, plus additional devices for your home office set up
In house conversational German classes for beginners
Subsidized Urban Sports Club Membership or BVG Deutschland Ticket
Mental well-being support, including individual sessions, through our partner Likeminded
Premium relocation support for colleagues outside of Germany: visa application support, assistance with searching temporary accommodation, payment of the first monthly rent
Company pension scheme and personal accident insurance
Corporate discounts from a wide range of external partners

Show more

Title: Data Analyst / Decision Scientist, Help Experience
Description:
Brief info about Vinted

Vinted Marketplace is the largest online international C2C marketplace in Europe dedicated to second-hand fashion, with millions of registered members spanning 22 markets in Europe and North America. With a mission to make second-hand the first choice worldwide, Vinted enables people to sell and buy second-hand clothes and lifestyle items from each other, helping give those items a second or even third life.

Vinted Go launched in 2022, with a focus on developing products and solutions for more seamless shipping and delivery across Europe. Vinted Go has connected more than 40 carriers and more than 200,000 PUDO points across Europe to support the delivery of millions of parcels per year.

The Vinted Group, composed of Vinted Marketplace and Vinted Go, is headquartered in Vilnius, with workplaces in Germany, Lithuania, France, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and over 2,000 employees. It is backed by six leading venture capital firms: Accel, Burda Principal Investments, EQT Growth, Insight Partners, Lightspeed Venture Partners, and Sprints Capital.

Information about the position

As our new Decision Scientist, you‚Äôll become part of a cross-functional team in the Help Experience domain with a mission to enable an effortless, scalable and cost effective support experience for our Vinted members. Your team‚Äôs focus will be on supporting our Member Support function and enabling quality and efficiency improvements through automation, self-service, and operational excellence.

We‚Äôre looking for someone who is a strategic thinker, a problem solver, with a strong data background, who aims high. You like to work in a fast-changing environment, and you are passionate about the product we‚Äôre building together.

Next to the product team you will be part of the cross-domain Data Science & Analytics (DSA) guild where you will interact and learn from all data people in Vinted. Within Data Science & Analytics (DSA) we have three distinct roles. To understand your role within DSA context better, here are brief descriptions of each role we have in the department:


Decision Scientists are responsible for actionable insights, identifying and sizing opportunities, and automated tools that increase the quality of product and business decisions by applying statistical methods and data-driven decision making.
Analytics Engineers are responsible for data curation ‚Äì translating data needs from stakeholders into architecting, building and maintaining efficient & reliable data models and pipelines.
Data Scientists are responsible for identification of algorithmic opportunities, ensuring those opportunities are addressed in an optimal fashion and design, development and maintenance of production-grade statistical and machine learning algorithms.


You will report to the Director of data science & analytics in Help Experience and work closely with other leaders in the domain, particularly in the data science & analytics and product functions.

In this position, you‚Äôll


Collaborate with your team and direct stakeholders to identify strategic opportunities and answer key business questions
Ensure these questions are answered in an optimal fashion (e.g. in the form of an ad hoc deep-dive, experiment, dashboard, or automatically recurring analysis)
Analyze identified opportunities to understand their scope and impact (i.e. size opportunities)
Own the key performance indicators for a team, including selection, tracking, forecasting, and proactively flagging issues
Enable your team and direct stakeholders to independently leverage data for business insights via self-serving and dashboarding tools (Looker)
Define the requirements for (A/B) testing and analyze the results of (A/B) tests
Help to create a backlog with prioritized hypotheses and analyses


About You


Demonstratable experience as a Decision Scientist, Data Analyst, Product Analyst or a Strategic role with a strong data component.
BSc or MSc in Applied Mathematics, Data Science, Computer Science, Economics, Statistics, Econometrics, or another related field (equivalent working experience is also acceptable)
Highly business-oriented and comfortable with iterative processes
A good communicator who can present complex topics clearly and persuasively to different audiences
Excellent written and spoken English
Are able to balance between analyses depth (time needed) and business impact
Ability to deal with uncertainty and to combine data insights with strategic thinking
Statistical proficiency (e.g. A/B testing, regression analysis)
Advanced knowledge of at least one statistical programming language (Python, R, etc.)
Fluency with SQL and experience with dashboarding tools (e.g. Looker, Tableau, etc.)


Work perks


The opportunity to benefit from our share options programme
30 days of paid annual leave
Newest MacBook models
Mental and emotional health support through the Mindletic app
Home office support: we provide IT workstation equipment and a personal budget of up to ‚Ç¨540 for home workplace furniture
A daily lunch allowance
Frequent team-building events
A personal monthly budget for shopping on Vinted
A subsidised gym membership with ClassPass or Urban Sports Card
A subsidised pension plan provided by Vinted
Hallesche Supplemental health insurance
Life and disability insurance provided
A subsidised Deutschlandticket
The opportunity to spend up to 90 days per year - 21 of which can be spent working outside of the EU - on workation
A dog-friendly office


Working at Vinted

Individual Learning Budget

Vinted will set aside a yearly sum equal to 10-13.2% of your annual salary to be invested in your continuous professional development. You‚Äôll be able to take the initiative to use it for covering relevant learning activities that benefit your role.

Hybrid Work

We‚Äôve adopted a hybrid workplace model where 2 days in the office are recommended but not enforced. It‚Äôs up to you and your team to decide on the exact days you‚Äôll spend working together in person.

Equal Opportunity

The Vinted Group is committed to building an inclusive workplace where people from all walks of life feel a sense of belonging. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, identities and life experiences. At Vinted, all applicants are treated fairly without regard to their race, age, religion or belief, sex, national origin, citizenship, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, or any other protected characteristic.

The salary range for this position is ‚Ç¨69,000 - ‚Ç¨93,400 gross per year.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a skilled Python and SQL user with a strong analytical background? Are you passionate about uncovering insights within data and applying them to real-world financial challenges? Then you might just be the Data Analyst we're looking for!

Your Primary Responsibilities Will Be


Manage the end-to-end process of data-driven knowledge gathering (connect, mine, simulate, predict, illustrate, and deploy)
Create data-based solutions to address complex business challenges


What We're Looking For


Solid analytical skills (you're a natural problem solver)
Proficiency in Python and SQL (you can write advanced queries with ease)
Focus on quality (you strive for excellence in everything you do)
Strong communication skills (you can explain complex ideas in simple terms)


It Would Be Great If You Also Have


Knowledge of financial markets (options, futures, etc.)
Familiarity with financial products


If it seems like a match, don't wait! Apply now and show us what you've got üî•

What we offer;

At LYNX, we value your growth and development; we'll provide you with a supportive work environment and opportunities for your professional development.


Competitive Salary, depending on your educational level and work experience;
Pension scheme that is fully paid by LYNX;
Free lunch from our cook or lunch ticket, fresh juices & fruit;
Travel allowance;
Continuous growth potential and a training budget of ‚Ç¨ 2,000 per year;
Trips & activities with your colleagues;
Relaxed and informal working environment.


About Us

"LYNX helps you invest in yourself"

"Working at LYNX means joining the LYNX family"

"The development opportunities make LYNX the best place to work"

This is what the employees say about LYNX and it is exactly what we want to offer: a work environment where you can get the best out of yourself. At our office in the heart of Amsterdam, Ghent, Berlin and Prague, we work every day to offer both private and professional clients the best trading opportunities, with a fast, user-friendly and reliable trading platform.

The Best Choice For Anyone Who Takes Investing Seriously

LYNX is an international FinTech that offers you a relaxed and informal work environment, where you can get the best out of yourself and where 300 people contribute together to the success of our customers since 2006.

In 2006 LYNX entered the investor market with two spearheads: very low rates and an extensive product range. This makes the online broker not only successful in the Netherlands, but also abroad. After opening offices in Belgium, Germany and the Czech Republic, LYNX now offers its services in ten different countries, making it a European broker of size.

In 2019 the product of LYNX, and therefore the offer for investors, has been greatly improved. For example, a highly advanced mobile and tablet app is available, the LYNX Masterclass webinars can be watched weekly via the Knowledge Portal, and thanks to the Morning Call, investors are quickly daily informed about the latest news on the financial markets.

Title: Sales Data Analyst (x/f/m)
Description:
Werde Teil unserer Mission, werde Teil von Doctolib!

Doctolib sucht einen erfahrenen Sales Data Analyst (x/f/m), der unsere Sales Teams unterst√ºtzt und wertvolle Einblicke aus unseren Verkaufsdaten gewinnt. Als Teil des Sales Excellence Teams optimierst du Effizienz und Leistung unserer Vertriebsteams und tr√§gst damit direkt zum Erfolg des Deutschland-Gesch√§fts bei.

Deine Aufgaben


Du identifizierst Verbesserungspotentiale auf Basis unserer Datengrundlage und leitest daraus Ma√ünahmen ab, um die Performance unserer Sales Team zu verbessern
Du baust Analysen f√ºr das Management und unterst√ºtzt Entscheidungsprozesse mit Hilfe von fundierten Datengrundlagen
Du vereinfachst den Zugang zu relevanten Sales-Daten mit Hilfe von Dashboards und Self-Service Tools
Du trainierst die User (Sales Manager:innen), damit sie die aufbereiteten Daten zur Effizienzsteigerung verschiedener Sales-Prozesse nutzen k√∂nnen
Du bist die zentrale Kontaktperson f√ºr unser globales Data Team, um die Data Roadmap und die Anfragen f√ºr Dashboards und Ad-hoc Data Requests zu besprechen
Du lernst mit unseren BI / Reporting Tools Periscope Data und Tableau umzugehen - hierzu bieten wir dir eine ausf√ºhrliche Einarbeitung



Dein Profil

Vorab der kurze Hinweis: Falls Du dem unten beschriebenen Profil nicht exakt entsprichst, aber trotzdem der Meinung bist, dass die Stellenausschreibung zu Deinen F√§higkeiten passt: Bewirb Dich gerne trotzdem!

Um Teil unseres Teams zu werden, bringst du Folgendes mit:


Du bringst min. 3 Jahre Erfahrung im Bereich Sales Performance / Strategy / Data Analytics oder einem √§hnlichen Bereich mit

Title: Data Analyst (m/f/x)
Description:
Carhartt WIP is part of the WIP Trading AG. Our family-owned business group started as a licensee and European distributor of the US workwear manufacturer Carhartt in the early 1990s. Since then, it develops its own collections based on workwear originals.




Carhartt Work In Progress aims to continuously progress and evolve, without ever losing sight of its origins. Over the course of the past two decades, our business has developed organically, along with its customers, the culture that surrounds the brand, and its employees who have helped shape what Carhartt WIP is today.




Your Responsibilities:

Management of and participation in Ecom&ERP projects in the BI environment
Implementation of change requests from the Ecom/CRM Team in the BI environment
Close cooperation with external service providers and partners
Ensuring operation & support for the BI systems of the Carhartt WIP Ecom&APP
Technical contact for the BI architecture in the ERP/Ecom environment




Your Profile:

Very good technical understanding of ERP, Commercetools and DWH architecture
At least 5 years of professional experience in a comparable function
Experience in working with Power BI is a plus
Entrepreneurial mindset and high customer orientation
Hands on and agile Mindset
Very good process understanding in the ecom&retail landscape
Very good technological understanding in the reporting area
Good analytical and logical thinking skills
Very good communication skills




Your Benefits:

Be part of the progress - find your place in our unique WIP culture
As part of the WIP crew you have the opportunity to connect at our events or just have fun
Your closet benefits from our staff discounts
Your future, our upgrade - we subsidise your company pension scheme by 100%
Your well-being is important to us - we contribute to this with free beverages




Your Location:

Berlin (Kreuzberg) / Germany

Show more

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Job Summary:

You will collaborate closely with the Business Intelligence Lead to analyze data trends, develop insightful reports, and contribute to the strategic execution of our advertising campaigns. Your expertise will help optimize our ad performance and ensure a successful peak season.

Key Responsibilities:

- Collaborate with Marketing Managers to align data analysis with overall Ads product strategy.

- Assist with the development and implementation of operational tools for peak season planning, becoming the go-to expert.

- Work with cross-functional teams to support operational excellence and drive automation initiatives.

- Engage with global stakeholders to provide data-driven insights and recommendations for Ads product enhancements.

- Take charge of data collection, analysis, and reporting tasks to support decision-making during Q4 peak season.

- Contribute to the design and execution of A/B testing to optimize campaign performance.

- Synthesize complex data into actionable reports for the marketing team and senior management.

- Assist in the management and quality assurance of campaign content and audience targeting.

Qualifications:

- Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Marketing, Business, Statistics, Economics, or equivalent experience.

- Minimum of 3 years of experience in a data analysis role ideally within a marketing or ad-tech environment.

- Proficient in data analysis tools (SQL, Excel, Tableau, etc.)

- Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and generate meaningful insights.

- Exceptional organizational and project management abilities, capable of handling multiple tasks with precision.

- Excellent communication skills, with the aptitude to present data findings clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences.

- A proactive mindset, with a willingness to take initiative and drive projects forward.

- Adaptable and resilient, able to thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic work environment.

Title: Customer Data Analyst (Customer Segmentation) (all genders)
Description:
THE ROLE & THE TEAM

You work for the Customer Analytics team in Zalando‚Äôs Markets organization, which enables data driven business strategies for 20+ countries. Through our customer focussed analytics and segmentations we put our customers at the center of every marketing and retail decision. As a (Senior) Customer Data Analyst in our Customer Segmentation Team you are the closest link to our customer You build a deep understanding of our customer base by developing and analyzing different customer segments based on their purchasing behavior, interests, customer value and onsite activities. You will transform data and segmentations into actionable insights and recommendations that drive strategic decisions and customer retention.

WHAT WE‚ÄôD LOVE YOU TO DO (AND LOVE DOING)



Develop and analyze customer segmentations and audiences, support targeting and steering initiatives to drive customer value and retention. Collaborate with data scientists and engineers to optimize and productionalize your segmentations and audience selections.
Design, conduct and evaluate A/B tests to optimize your segmentations and audiences according to their use case. Recommend testing strategies to optimize targeted campaigns, campaign efficiency and ultimately customer value and retention. Translate complex questions into sound analytical tasks, autonomously planning large scale projects.
Collaborate with business stakeholders to identify new strategic opportunities and recommend actions supporting the customer strategy. Present your findings and work closely with business stakeholders and product owners to operationalize your recommendations.
Drive data mindset in the team and provide senior guidance to your team members in terms of methodology & technology to raise the bar within the department. Collaborate with other analysts, data scientists, engineers and commercial colleagues to untap new sources of data and know-how.
Independently manage analytical projects, identifying efficiency opportunities and supporting decision-making with insights from descriptive and inferential analysis.
Conduct knowledge-sharing sessions, support junior colleagues, and contribute to internal events and the hiring process.



WE‚ÄôD LOVE TO MEET YOU IF



You have 3+ years experience in using customer data in smart and creative ways to answer business questions and/or drive targeting efforts incl. model driven statistical analysis, e.g. Causal Inference. Very good quantitative degree, e.g. in Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science.
Advanced skills in data methodologies and technologies (Python and SQL, PySpark). Visualization tools, e.g. MicroStrategy, Tableau, PowerBI and versioning tools, e.g. Git/GitHub, are considered a plus. Curious about learning new technologies, e.g. Databricks, AWS data lake, Airflow.
Strong communicator to challenge the status-quo, tell data stories, maximize decision impact of your results and liaison with commercial and tech people alike.
Proactive, fast learner, problem solver, teamplayer, comfortable working in English in a fast paced international work environment



INCLUSIVE BY DESIGN

At Zalando, our vision is to be inclusive by design. And this vision starts with our hiring - we do not discriminate on the basis of gender identity, sexual orientation, personal expression, ethnicity, religious belief, or disability status. You are welcome to leave out your picture, age, or marital status from your application. We only assess candidates on their qualifications and merit.

We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support you throughout the hiring process.

  • Gemeinsam wachsen: Dein Wissen ist unser aller Gewinn. Deshalb spielen wir dir regelm√§√üig Updates auf, in Form von Konferenzen, Workshops, Kursen, Trainings, neuster Technik ‚Äì was immer du brauchst, um dich beruflich und pers√∂nlich weiterzuentwickeln.
  • Kein Lari-Fari: Was du tust, vergammelt nicht in einer Schublade, sondern kommt zum Einsatz. Auf unn√∂tige B√ºrokratie und stundenlange Meetings haben wir keine Lust. Wir arbeiten fokussiert, hands-on und mit einem Blick f√ºrs Wesentliche.

√úber uns

Gestalte mit uns die Zukunft der Kommunikation!

Bist du bereit f√ºr den n√§chsten Schritt? Wir suchen kreative K√∂pfe, die mit uns und mit Hilfe von KI-gest√ºtzten Technologien die Art und Weise, wie Unternehmen interagieren, neu definieren wollen. Lass dich von unserer Vision inspirieren und entdecke spannenden Karrierem√∂glichkeiten bei uns ‚Äì bewirb dich noch heute auf unsere offenen Stellen!

Du m√∂chtest mehr √ºber uns erfahren? ‚û°Ô∏è comdesk.de/ueber-uns

Title: Graduate Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Bring your data analytics and data mining skills to a unique team seeking to understand and shape the future of marketing technology. We are interested in technology adoption patterns, the respect of visitors' data and the use of open source in marketing. We are also interested in those marketing data analysts who are curious enough to embrace new technologies and are ready to work with unfamiliar tools, if needed.

The role of a Graduate Marketing Data Analyst at Canonical

Canonical has provided developers with open source since 2004, helping them build innovations such as public cloud, machine learning, robotics or blockchain. Marketing at Canonical means being at the forefront of innovation, for our customers and for our own martech stack. We're on the look out for a marketing data analyst to join our team and execute on our growth hacking strategy.

The ideal candidate will be passionate about technology, technology marketing and the use of technology in marketing. You will prefer to work in an environment that has emphasis on ownership of campaigns, collaboration, learning, curiosity and a drive to continually improve oneself / the team / the organisation. You will also love to problem solve, get hands-on, experiment, measure and use automation to make daily life easier.

The Marketing team at Canonical drives commercial outcomes for the company across its portfolio of products and grows the addressable market through digital marketing campaigns, lifecycle management, events, partnerships and community development. If these things are important to you and you're motivated by driving growth, delighting customers and filling the sales funnel, we want to talk with you.

This role sits in the Marketing team reporting to the Growth Engineering Manager.

Location: This role will be based remotely in the EMEA region.

What your day will look like


Utilise advanced data analytics to grow Canonical's product adoption and market penetration
Focus on quantitative and qualitative data analytics to find insights and meaningful business outcomes
Design and conduct experiments with data, visualisation and insights into Canonical's target audiences
Collaborate with stakeholder teams (Product Management, Engineering, Information Systems, Finance, RevOps, etc) to improve the data and tool ecosystem
Put in place and maintain systems to ensure teams across the company have self-service access to data dashboards


What we are looking for in you?


A recent graduate with background in data science, mathematics, actuarial science, or engineering
Knowledge in advanced statistics, data sciences, coding/scripting languages (Python, JS, etc), and databases (SQL, etc)
Strength in data analytics and visualisation (Looker Studio, Tableau, Apache Superset, etc)
Ability to translate business questions to key research objectives
Ability to identify the best methodology to execute research, synthesise and analyse findings
Excellent writing and communication skills
Willingness to examine the status quo and resilient in the face of challenges


What we offer you

Your base pay will depend on various factors including your geographical location, level of experience, knowledge and skills. In addition to the benefits above, certain roles are also eligible for additional benefits and rewards including annual bonuses and sales incentives based on revenue or utilisation. Our compensation philosophy is to ensure equity right across our global workforce.

In addition to a competitive base pay, we provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. Please note that additional benefits may apply depending on the work location and, for more information on these, you can ask in the later stages of the recruitment process.

üè†Fully remote working environment - we've been working remotely since 2004!

üìöPersonal learning and development budget of 2,000 USD per annum

üí∞Annual compensation review

üèÜRecognition rewards

üèù Annual holiday leave

üë∂Parental Leave

üßë‚ÄçüíºEmployee Assistance Programme

üß≥Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues at 'sprints'

‚úàÔ∏èPriority Pass for travel and travel upgrades for long haul company events

About Canonical

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm that is at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world on a daily basis. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do.

Canonical has been a remote-first company since its inception in 2004. Work at Canonical is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game. Canonical provides a unique window into the world of 21st-century digital business.

Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Do you have strong background in Data Analysis?




Do you want to apply your skills and grow within a growing market?




We've partnered with a leading supplier of modern and professional learning solutions.




You will analyze large amounts of data to identify trends in their SaaS platform and generate insights. Through these analyses, you will generate insights for their product team and various stakeholders and actively contribute to their data driven product development.




Please apply if you have the following:

A bachelor's degree in Information Systems, Computer Science, Business Analytics, or a related field.
You can record, analyze, develop solutions and master various tools for data analysis and visualization such as Mixpanel or Looker Studio.
Strong analytical skills with storytelling and visualization techniques to prepare findings in a way that is appropriate for the target group.
Ideally, you have knowledge of SQL, Python or R.
You have experience with cloud-based data platforms.
You have experience in sales processes and automation and data structures (ideally in Salesforce).
You have experience in an agile environment
6+ years industry experience




Nice to have:

Good communication skills in German and English




This is an urgent position. If the above stands out to you and you feel you are right for the role, please do send in your application/ get in touch with a member of the Big Cloud team as soon as possible. Please be aware, we try to reply to all applications, but we‚Äôre only human, for now! Please bare in-mind, you may only hear from us if you are successful.

Title: Data Analyst, Finance & Strategy
Description:
About Gelato

Gelato has built the world's largest and most global network for on-demand production of customized items e.g. t-shirts, wall art, mugs, books, hoodies, and cards. We support a new wave of e-commerce entrepreneurs to sell their creativity globally, with a more local and sustainable production. With local production and exact matching of supply and demand, there is no waste, and carbon emissions are reduced.

We own no assets - we build the software that connects world-class production facilities all across the world. We have more than 130 production partners in 32 countries. In 72 hours we can reach more than 5 billion people with customized products in a smarter, faster, and greener way.

Gelato is changing the way that customized products can be produced on-demand. We are already empowering thousands of e-commerce entrepreneurs to grow and scale their businesses. With local production, and exact matching of supply and demand, there is no waste and carbon emissions are reduced.

Gelato consists of three different business units:

Optimalprint - our B2C e-commerce business, offering beautiful high-quality personalized products to consumers all over the world. The products are produced on-demand by Gelato‚Äôs local production network.

GelatoCreate - giving creators across the world instant access to a global market of customers. Simple integrations to webshops such as Shopify, Etsy and TikTok allow creators to connect and personalize their designs for a wide range of quality products, and Gelato takes care of the production and fulfillment through our local production.

GelatoConnect - the backbone of Gelato is enterprise software that powers the world's most advanced production on demand facilities, providing unmatched production workflow, logistics and procurement efficiency, quality management and cost savings.




What we are looking for

We are seeking analytics professionals with a passion for business impact to join our world class Finance & Strategy team. As a Data Analyst, you will help build strategic reports for investor and leadership teams and carry out analysis that will inform important financial and strategic decisions for Gelato. You will guide the finance team using data and insights by not simply presenting data, but telling data-driven stories. You will convince and influence your finance and strategy team members using clear insights and recommendations.

The position is based in Gelato‚Äôs offices in London (UK), Oslo (Norway), Stockholm (Sweden), and Madrid (Spain)

What you will be doing

Own the design, development, and maintenance of metrics, reports and dashboards to drive key business performance visibility for finance and strategy teams.
Identify trends & patterns using internal and external data sources powered with analytic models to provide actionable insights to business decision-makers.
Generate forecasts, recommendations, and strategic/tactical plans necessary to drive and influence business decision-making.
Share your knowledge and build creative solutions while helping the team evolve best practices.

Who you are

4 years+ of data analytics experience.
Strong attention to detail, ensuring accuracy and integrity in all your analyses
Good time management. You can handle multiple tasks, meeting deadlines without compromising quality.
Collaborative. You work well in a team environment, collaborating effectively with cross-functional teams.
Strong project and stakeholder management skills. You keep all stakeholders informed and manage expectations effectively.
Extensive hands-on experience in SQL.
Experience with data visualization and BI tools like Looker/Tableau/PowerBI.
Good knowledge of statistical analysis.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.

Preferred Qualifications

Experience with finance data or in finance related roles.
Advanced experience with Looker.
Experience in management consulting would be a plus.

What we offer

We offer you a chance to be part of a truly amazing journey in a company that sets very high targets and works hard to achieve them. You will be able to work with smart, motivated, and engaged co-workers from all over the world, in an intense and very energetic environment. This leads to you having a tangible impact on the way that we operate and expand our business.

Some of the highlights of the package include:

Strong technical culture of continuous innovation and improvement
Chance to become a shareholder of Gelato!
Flexible festive holidays, swap days off according to your values and beliefs.
Work at one of our hub city offices or even remotely
And much much more!

What it‚Äôs like to work at Gelato

We are a customer-obsessed team with the ambition to change the world by connecting technology to the printing industry and making it much more sustainable. Everyone who joins our team must feel genuinely intrigued and motivated by our mission. We expect a lot. We are a driven team with big goals, so we seek individuals who are genuinely passionate about their work and possess an entrepreneurial spirit. Our culture is unique and we live by our values, so it's worth learning more about our culture and how we work before presenting your application.

At Gelato, we pride ourselves on our global presence with 14 offices worldwide, fostering a dynamic and diverse work environment. Rooted in a culture that values collaboration, creativity, and camaraderie, we actively cultivate a company culture that thrives on shared experiences. We encourage team members to embrace this culture by working from our inspiring office spaces at least three days a week, allowing for meaningful connections and collective growth.

Lastly, we ask that you please upload your CV in English, regardless of which country you are applying from.

Title: Senior Data Analyst (m/f/d)
Description:
THIS IS US

At Oetker Digital, we partner with the Oetker Group companies to define what digital business transformation means and to create business value and impact based on data, technology and talents, so that they can unlock their digital future. We support many beloved brands such as Dr. Oetker, Radeberger and Coppenrath & Wiese.

With our team of about 100 talented individuals from diverse backgrounds, based in our Berlin headquarters, we foster an open, positive learning culture, driven by our shared values and the spirit of a family-run company.







THE ROLE

As a Senior Data Analyst at Oetker Digital, you will play a critical role in owning and leveraging data to drive business decisions and strategies. You will work closely with various teams and business partners on the side of our Group companies to ask the right questions, deeply understand the business domains and processes, analyze datasets, generate insights and business cases based on data that help our brands grow and succeed in the digital space. Your expertise will guide the optimization of brand, marketing and sales strategies, product development, and customer engagement initiatives.







WHAT YOU'LL DO

Partner and collaborate closely with business stakeholders to understand their strategies, needs and objectives
Develop and maintain strong relationships with key business partners to ensure data solutions align with business goals
Act as a consultant, using probing questions to gain deep insights into the business domain and processes
Analyze datasets to extract actionable insights and support data-driven decision making
Develop and implement statistical models to solve complex business problems
Communicate insights in a compelling and accessible manner to support data-driven decision-making
Translate complex data findings into clear, actionable insights through effective data storytelling







WHAT YOU'LL BRING

At least 5 years of experience in data analysis or data consulting, preferably within a business context, preferably in Consulting
A Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in a related field (e.g., Economics, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science)
Proficiency in SQL and/or Python for data analysis and modeling
Experiences with Cloud platforms for data storage and processing, having worked with BigQuery is a plus
Experience with data visualization tools such as Power BI or Tableau
Experience in Marketing Analytics & Optimization
A proactive and collaborative mindset, with the ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to communicate complex ideas clearly
You like to learn, work hands-on, take ownership, and have an impact
Fluent in German and English







WHAT WE OFFER

Modern and dog friendly office located at the heart of Berlin
Hybrid working model with flexible working hours for a healthy work-life balance
We work in cross-functional and international teams and have regular company/team events
28 days of paid vacation, plus Christmas and New Year‚Äôs Eve off, as well as the possibility to take a sabbatical or additional unpaid leave
10 paid child‚Äôs sick days per year
Annual learning and development budget purchase educational resources up to ‚Ç¨1.500
Equipment of your choice: Macbook or Lenovo, plus additional devices for your home office set up
Subsidized Urban Sports Club Membership or BVG Deutschland Ticket
Mental well-being support, including individual sessions, through our partner Likeminded
Company pension scheme and personal accident insurance
Corporate discounts from a wide range of external partners







Diversity and Inclusion

At Oetker Digital, we believe that diversity, equity and inclusion are crucial elements of a respectful and inspiring workplace. We value the unique experiences that each individual brings to our team, and we are committed to creating a culture where everyone feels valued.

We are an equal opportunity employer and welcome applications from candidates of all walks of life, backgrounds, identities, and experiences. Even if you don't meet all the requirements above, we actively encourage you to apply. We're eager to learn about the perspective you can bring to our team!

We support many beloved brands such as Dr. Oetker, Radeberger and Coppenrath & Wiese.

With our team of about 100 talented individuals from diverse backgrounds, based in our Berlin headquarters, we foster an open, positive learning culture, driven by our shared values and the spirit of a family-run company.



THE ROLE

As a Senior Data Analyst at Oetker Digital, you will play a critical role in owning and leveraging data to drive business decisions and strategies. You will work closely with various teams and business partners on the side of our Group companies to ask the right questions, deeply understand the business domains and processes, analyze datasets, generate insights and business cases based on data that help our brands grow and succeed in the digital space. Title: Senior Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst (f/m/x)
Description:
At Seven Senders, we connect people and markets, making international shipping a simple matter.

We are the leading platform for cross-border parcel delivery in Europe. We support e-commerce companies in successfully implementing their growth and internationalization plans and connecting millions of consumers with their desired products. Whether the focus is on speed or cost efficiency, we provide direct access to Europe's premier local carriers. Responsible for the daily end-to-end supply chain from the warehouse to the customer's doorstep, we ensure the parcels reach their destination efficiently and reliably.

Our mission is to connect markets with unparalleled ease using our innovative platform, which combines the best European delivery services with local logistics expertise. Since Johannes Plehn and Thomas Hagemann founded the company in Berlin in 2015, we've grown into a dedicated team of over 220 professionals. Today, we're proud to serve renowned clients such as ASOS, Shop Apotheke and Tamaris, continually advancing our journey as a European operating champion.



Job Description



At Seven Senders, our Business Intelligence team, led by Jimi Herrera, stands as the cornerstone of our data-driven ethos. We champion self-sufficient BI, fueling analytics and informed decisions with cutting-edge technology and streamlined workflows. We merge internal and external data from the 7S supply chain within our data hub, delivering enhanced intelligence and optimal automation to all stakeholders.


In this role, you will work closely with our data engineers to provide the best data models and collaborate with different stakeholders from the business on all levels to make data-driven decisions. You will be working to conduct a thorough analysis of large and complex data sets to extract meaningful insights.


The essence of your role

Develop and maintain robust data models, reports, and dashboards to analyze and visualize complex datasets.
Identify opportunities to improve processes and strategies with technology solutions.
Ensure quality control over data, analyses, and metrics.
Provide recommendations to the business by interpreting disparate data and translating ad hoc requests to deliver relevant and impactful results consistently.
Work closely with Data Engineers to provide the best data models.



Qualifications



This is what you need to succeed

+4 years of professional experience as a Business Intelligence Analyst, Data Analyst, or in a relevant field.
Excellent SQL skills with experience with cloud-based data warehouse solutions (Snowflake experience is a plus).
High proficiency in data visualization tools like Looker, Tableau, Power BI, or similar tools.
Previous experience in e-commerce or logistics.
Proactive and solution-oriented attitude.



Additional Information



What we offer:

Flexible & Hybrid Work: Our office is at Alexanderplatz; we have a hybrid working model with flexible remote-office set-up and working hours. And if you wish, you can work from almost anywhere for up to 2 months per year.

Personal Growth: We want you to grow and develop your career with us. In addition to exciting opportunities, we offer a development platform with professional training programs and a culture that champions personal and career development.

Benefits: We offer a corporate benefits platform and German & English language courses.

Mission Zero: Climate-neutral and long-term impact. With our green initiatives, we are reaching climate neutrality for ourselves, and hopefully, we're inspiring the entire logistics sector to join us to create a sustainable future.

Vibrant Culture & Community: We embody collaboration, open doors, and no-fuss results focus, and we are successful with our data-driven and efficient working approach. We like to celebrate and come together, and we strive for a workplace buzzing with energy and camaraderie, highlighted by regular team events, BBQs, and company-wide celebrations.

Inclusive Environment: We value diversity and welcome all applicants regardless of ethnicity, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, or disability.

Show more

Title: Senior Revenue Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

What makes the Finance team so special is our ‚Äòservice first‚Äô approach to the job - we enjoy creating strong communication loops with the wider business, so that bottlenecks are minimized and that things get done quickly and efficiently.

Everybody is accountable for their own workload and takes pride in being meticulous and precise. We also enjoy learning and developing as we go - it‚Äôs important that you share this approach!

Day-to-day:


Provide support in the implementation of our revenue subledger to scale our revenue accounting to the next level
Work closely with Product, Analytics and Engineering on country rollouts and data validations
Manage cross functional processes with Product, Analytics, Engineering and other Accounting process owners, to collect and implement accounting requirements from the business related to revenue data flow
Perform proactive in-depth accounting analysis, measurement, and reconciliations of key revenue accounts
Prepare deliverables for external audit review and testing, and SOX control documentation for internal audit teams
Detect and resolve data issues and reconciliation gaps
Ad hoc analyses and projects as assigned


Our humble expectations


Degree in Accounting, Finance, Business, Data Science or related field
Intermediate/Advanced SQL skills and ability to pull and work with large volumes of transactional data
5-7 years of experience in Accounting/Data Analytics or related field
Strong analytical and problem solving skills with demonstrated understanding of Accounting processes
Clear and concise communication with strong cross-functional partnership experience
Experience with Snowflake, NetSuite, Looker preferred
Data-obsessed and unafraid to go down to the lowest level of detail for truth
You are able to balance between attention to detail and swift execution
Experience in the gig economy or marketplace company is a plus
Comfortable using English as a working language
Must be eligible to work in the E.U.


Next Steps

Why you'll love working with us


Continuous learning: Significant growth in a fast-scaling global tech firm.
Competitive compensation: Attractive salary package including stock options.
Flexible environment: Embrace a hybrid work model, blending office presence with flexibility.


If you are excited about working in a high-growth environment, taking ownership, and being part of an extremely ambitious team, then click below to apply and get the conversation going!

We will be reviewing applications on an ongoing basis, so if this sounds like an opportunity you want to pursue, apply today!

If you have any further questions about the position, you can turn to: Talent Acquisition Partner - timur.novopashin@wolt.com

Please note that we do not accept applications coming through email due to GDPR. Make sure to apply through our careers page, and submit your application in English!

About Wolt

Wolt is a technology company that makes it incredibly easy to discover and get the best restaurants, grocery stores and other local shops delivered to your home or office. Wolt works together with over 30,000 restaurant and retail partners as well as with over 60,000 courier partners across 27 countries and 210 cities.

Our apps (iOS and Android) have the industry‚Äôs highest reviews, largely because of our customer-centric approach to how we build our products and operations. For example, our customer service team responds in a matter of seconds, in the customer‚Äôs own language.

In 2020, the Financial Times named us Europe‚Äôs second fastest growing company. We‚Äôre still expanding rapidly and are looking for more talented individuals to join us. If you are passionate about cutting-edge technology, great food, and making an impact in your city, then Wolt just might be for you.

Title: Remote Data Integrity Analyst
Description:
Job Description

We are looking for a meticulous Remote Data Integrity Analyst to ensure the accuracy and reliability of our data entries into company databases and CRM systems. The ideal candidate will have strong analytical skills, a keen eye for detail, and a commitment to data integrity.

Responsibilities:


Verify and correct data entries for accuracy and completeness.
Conduct regular data audits to ensure data integrity.
Maintain confidentiality and handle sensitive information responsibly.
Perform regular data backups and digital filing.
Assist with other administrative tasks as required.


Qualifications:


High school diploma or equivalent; additional education or certification in data management is a plus.
Proven experience as a data entry clerk or similar position.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel) and Google Workspace.
Familiarity with data entry software and tools.
Strong attention to detail and organizational skills.
Ability to work independently with minimal supervision.
Reliable internet connection and a quiet workspace.


Benefits:


Competitive hourly wage.
Flexible working hours.
Opportunity to work from the comfort of your home.
Supportive and collaborative team environment.
Opportunities for career growth and advancement.

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Customer Analytics (all genders)
Description:
You work for the Customer Analytics team in Zalando‚Äôs Markets organisation, which enables data driven business strategies for 20+ countries. Through our customer analytics and customer segmentations we put our customers at the centre of every marketing and retail decision. As a Data Analyst in the Customer Analytics team, you will put customer data at the core of our decisions and processes.

WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED



You derive actionable customer insights and recommendations to fuel our Zalando business and the customer strategy. Your insights are derived from deep dive analysis you perform using a broad range of analytical methods and visualisations applied to data from various sources (transactional data, onsite data etc)
You proactively share your insights and recommendations in regular business reviews to senior management by providing compelling visualisations and stories. You seek opportunities to spread the insights beyond regular touchpoints with the aim of sourcing new business opportunities
You develop and optimise forecasting models for key customer metrics and provide expertise on current and expected trends for central planning efforts in close collaboration with our commercial planning teams
You drive analytical and data mindset in the team and provide senior guidance to your team members
You effectively collaborate with other analysts, data scientists, engineers to untap new sources of data and know how



What We‚Äôre Looking For



5+ years of experience in using data in smart and creative ways to answer business questions incl. model driven statistical analysis. Very good quantitative degree, e.g. in Economics, Social Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science or related fields.
Proficient in data transformation and statistical computing in SQL and Python as well as strong skills in data visualisation. Basic experience in Google Analytics (BigQuery), MicroStrategy/Tableau, Airflow, Spark / DataBricks, and / or Github. Knowledge of basic time series forecasting techniques (SARIMAX, Prophet, Covariates) is considered a plus
Strong communication and visualisation skills and the ability to translate complex datasets into understandable and actionable insights and present to senior management in order to impact their decisions and strategy
Being curious and proactively creating insights while demonstrating end to end ownership of analytical projects. You innovate on new methodologies and datasets but also have a good sense when an pragmatic solution is sufficient
You are a role model and proved to be a mentor for junior to mid level team members



OUR OFFER

Zalando provides a range of benefits, here‚Äôs an overview of what you can expect. Ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about what we offer.



Employee shares program
40% off fashion and beauty products sold and shipped by Zalando, 30% off Zalando Lounge, discounts from external partners
2 paid volunteering days a year
Hybrid working model with 60% (or more) remote per week, actual practice is up to each team to best support their collaboration
Work from abroad for up to 30 working days a year
27 days of vacation a year (for Zalando SE)
Relocation assistance available (subject to prior agreement)
Family services, including counseling and support
Health and wellbeing options (including Gympass)
Mental health support and coaching available



Learn all about Zalando and our values here https //jobs.zalando.com/en/?gh_src=22377bdd1us

Title: Data Analyst (0 Experience Required)
Description:
For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.




At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.




As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.




With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.




So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!




Ideal Candidate

Fluent in English and German.
Excellent research skills.
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Germany.
Analytical mindset.




Job Requirements

Must be living in Germany for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.




Benefits




¬∑ Work up to 20 hours per week.

¬∑ Earn a competitive rate of pay.

¬∑ Develop your research skills.

¬∑ Avoid the long commute.

¬∑ Work from the comfort of your home office.

¬∑ Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!




Apply Online Today!

Title: Staff Data Analyst - Digital Tracking (f/m/x)
Description:
The role

Our Behavioral Data Squad is a cross-functional team with end-to-end ownership of digital tracking across all markets globally at HelloFresh, from infrastructure all the way to the curated data products. As our Staff Data Analyst, you will play an integral part in ensuring data quality, governance and observability by defining and building the metrics, visualisations, and targets within the squad. You will also be a data detective, deep diving into root cause analyses of tracking discrepancies or anomalous readings, to further drive up trust and adoption.

If you are an expert analyst and a self-starter, with the product-sense to create effective success metrics and use these to inspire trust in a global business, this could be the role for you. Your deep understanding of behavioural tracking infrastructure, data models, and how this data should be consumed efficiently will ensure your impact across the breadth of HelloTech, proactively identifying needs and pain points across Data Infrastructure, Platform, Engineering and Analytics, and defining solutions to constantly improve the way we work. So while you are an individual contributor, you are a key owner of best practices across our teams.

What You‚Äôll Do


Accountable for your teams‚Äô data catalogue and delivery documentation
Collaborate from a technical perspective with data product managers and data engineers to create reusable data products
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and define project objectives while utilising project management skills to plan and execute data-driven projects
Partner widely across the Senior Product organisation (Product, Software Engineering, UX leads) to set strategic priorities and promote a culture rooted in evidence-based decision making.
Communicate actionable insights clearly across the organisation highlighting the ‚Äúso-whats‚Äù of your analyses in order to drive the growth of our business.
Explore and analyse customer behaviour and product performance data in order to detect growth opportunities for the HelloFresh digital product by improving user experience.
Guide and mentor other Product Analysts within our team, defining best practices and providing support to help individuals and the team grow in effectiveness
Review as a technical expert the implementations of multiple teams across domains, continuously improving the deliverables of your teams


What You'll Bring


Experience with digital tracking and tag management in a B2C environment
Extensive experience in quantitative analysis roles, ideally including having worked closely with product teams for at least 5 years.
Excellent technical skills applying expert level SQL and Python for both analysis and efficient manipulation of large data sets.
Expert level knowledge of data visualisation tools like Tableau which we use to create compelling visualisations to convey complex data.
Extensive experience working with product stakeholders in setting up A|B experiments, interpreting results and deep diving to understand the impact of particular experiments.
Excellent communication skills, taking complex business problems, articulating these as analytical problems and presenting your findings in a clear and precise way.
Extensive leadership of complex projects you have led, capability building within your team, and through mentorship or direct people management.
A change mindset, the status quo is not an impediment
You are outcome oriented, and can take a business challenge, create actionable analytical insights against it, and align stakeholders on actions to create business value.

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Business Analytics
Description:
About GetYourGuide

GetYourGuide is the globally leading marketplace for unforgettable travel experiences. Travelers use GetYourGuide to discover the best things to do in a destination. Since its founding in 2009, people from all over the world have booked more than 150 million tours, activities, and attraction tickets through GetYourGuide. Powered by a global team of over 800 travel experts and technologists, we are headquartered in Berlin and have 17 local offices around the world. Visit our careers website to learn more.

Team mission

The Analytics team's mission is to enable the organisation to take action based on data. We work on a variety of problems and datasets as members of cross-functional mission teams. We take ownership of the entire analytics funnel, from exploration through recommendations to impact measurement, and take pride in the insights we generate.

This specific position is within our Business Analytics and will see you collaborate primarily with the Supply Tech Team to improve supplier engagement and, in turn increase the inventory available on the marketplace for our travellers

You Will


Develop quantitative analysis to drive product and business decisions and strategy
Explore large datasets, give meaning to data and numbers, identify opportunities and issues, and present findings to stakeholders
Design and implement metrics, dashboards, and reports
Serve as a liaison between the product teams and the data engineering team
Mentor others in the skills needed for this role


Who You Are


5+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in an analytics, data science or business intelligence role
Strong knowledge of SQL and Python for analysis (eg: pandas, scikit-learn)
Experience with data visualization and reporting tools (e.g. Looker, Jupyter Notebooks, Databricks)
Ability to understand user behavior and meaning behind the numbers
Desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction and with highly engaged individuals
Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English


Nice to have


Experience with big data tools (e.g. Spark, Hive) is a plus
Experience working in Marketplace business
Experience solving Marketplace operations questions, such as understanding inventory diversity.
Experience in statistical modelling.
Experience in B2B product analytics.


How We Set You Up For Success


Invest in your development with an annual personal growth budget
Create a comfortable workspace at home with an annual home office budget
Enjoy flexibility with a hybrid work-from-home and telecommuting policy
Save on transportation costs with discounted public transportation tickets
Support your loved ones with generous maternity and paternity leave policies


And more...

We look forward to hearing from you

Unlock your full potential and join our mission to create unforgettable experiences for millions around the world. If you have the skills and passion for joining our team, we invite you to apply by submitting your CV/resume in English through the form below. Check out how we hire for tips and visibility into our process and check out life at GetYourGuide. If you have any further questions, please do not hesitate to contact us via jobs@getyourguide.com.

We are an equal opportunity employer

Our commitment is that every qualified person will be evaluated according to skills regardless of age, gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability status, or religion. Please refrain from including your picture and age with the application.

Title: Lead Data Analyst (f/m/d)
Description:
Lead Data Analyst (f/m/d)




As a Lead Game Data Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in shaping our games' success by leveraging data insights to drive strategic decisions across game design, player behavior analysis, and monetization strategies. You will collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to ensure our games remain competitive and captivating in the dynamic gaming industry landscape.




We have ambitious plans around growth and the data team is integral to our success, directly impacting our key decisions.

As the Lead Data Analyst, you will lead a team of data analysts and spearhead our data efforts in Product, User Acquisition and monetization, leveraging data to drive decisions and strategies that significantly boost our performance and revenue.




Responsibilities




Lead and mentor a team of data analysts, fostering a culture of collaboration, innovation, and continuous learning.
Utilize exceptional problem-solving and critical-thinking skills to interpret complex game telemetry data and identify actionable insights.
Communicate effectively with stakeholders and executive leadership, presenting data-driven recommendations to drive informed decision-making.
Champion a data-driven culture within the organization, promoting data literacy and empowering team members to leverage key performance indicators (KPIs) for strategic initiatives.
Work with the Data Engineering team to help direct their efforts and be the key communicator between the main stakeholders in the company requiring data
Drive experimentation and A/B testing initiatives to evaluate the impact of game changes on player behavior, monetization, and engagement.
Analyze player retention and churn rates, identifying opportunities to enhance player experiences and maximize long-term value.
Collaborate with Product Leads and Head of Growth to influence product development and strategies by gaining insights through analysis of patterns, relationships and trends across complex data sets, directly impacting the company and game revenue.
Stay updated on industry trends and best practices, leveraging advanced understanding of game monetization and marketing strategies to maintain a competitive edge, as well as, digital marketing environment and marketing measuring frameworks.
Build and monitor predictive models that will help daily Product, User Acquisition and Monetization decisions.




Required Skills




5+ years of experience in data analysis in the gaming industry.
Proven experience managing a team, having exceptional leadership and team-building capabilities
Experience with real-time data analysis for live operations in games.
Ability to write complex queries using languages such as SQL
Experience using Python, BI tools such as Looker or similar
Previous experience with AB testing
Advanced understanding of game monetization and marketing strategies as well as key gaming industry KPIs and metrics
Games industry experience with a strong understanding of the game and player market
Strong problem-solving skills and creativity in addressing complex challenges.
Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills.
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.




Desirable Skills




Proficiency in additional programming languages (e.g., Java, C#, etc.).
Advanced understanding of game monetization and marketing strategies or game industry pattern
Experience with Product Data Science, including but not limited to Churn Prediction, LTV.
An applied understanding of Player Psychology and/or Economics.

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Operations (f/m/x)
Description:
CarOnSale is a start-up in the heart of Berlin. As a tech company, we have made it our mission to enable smooth digital processes in the automotive trade across Europe. Join us and develop new, innovative solutions for the B2B sector.

For our Operations based at our HQ in Berlin - Sch√∂neberg, we are looking for a Senior Data Analyst (f/m/x)

Your tasks:

Data Analysis:


Analyse and interpret data from various sources to extract meaningful insights.
Identify opportunities for data-driven decision-making within the organisation.
Define and maintain key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure success.



Project Leadership:


Lead data exploration projects to uncover actionable insights.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to identify and define data needs for various business initiatives.



Dashboard Creation:


Develop and maintain dashboards that enable stakeholders to monitor and analyse critical business metrics.



Report Generation:


Generate reports that provide valuable insights to support decision-making across multiple teams.



Stakeholder Management:


Engage with internal stakeholders to ensure their expectations align with our deliverables.
Manage multiple projects simultaneously, setting clear expectations for scope and timeline.
Cultivate and maintain strong relationships with stakeholders and product managers.



Enablement:


Provide support to enhance daily reporting and analytics tasks within the company.
Offer training and education to team members on data analysis tools and techniques for better decision-making



Your profile


4+ years‚Äô experience as a data analyst
Proven experience in data analysis, interpretation, and visualisation.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and languages (e.g., SQL, Tableau).
Experience working with Python.
Strong communication and presentation skills.
Ability to manage multiple projects with attention to detail.
Strong problem-solving and critical-thinking skills.
Familiarity with Google Analytics & tracking data
Fluency in English (C1)



Nice to have:


Being able to communicate in German



Why COS?


First things first: You‚Äôll be taken seriously from day one and will play an important role in our mission, because we want to disrupt Europe‚Äôs automotive market together with you
Growth and development: benefit from a detailed on-boarding program, systematic feedback cycles and individual coaching
Your gear, your choice: you will be provided with a MacBook or Windows laptop and all the hardware and software you need to work
Become a COSie: be part of a motivated team with ambitious goals and enjoy lots of fun, lots of awesome team events and a unique COS team spirit
Truly diverse and inclusive: Diversity is important to you? It is important to us too! Diversity in which everyone feels comfortable, is absolutely central to us

Title: Data Engineer (m/f/d)
Description:
At Digital Turbine, we make mobile advertising experiences more meaningful and rewarding for users, app publishers, and advertisers ‚Äî intelligently connecting people in more ways, across more devices. We provide app publishers and advertisers with powerful ads and experiences that captivate consumers, fuel performance, and help telecoms and OEMs supercharge awareness, acquisition, and monetization. In a rapidly evolving industry, we are constantly innovating and creating better paths of discovery to connect consumers, publishers, and advertisers across the mobile ecosystem.

About the Role:


Create highly scalable and fault tolerant technical designs working with team members (up to 5 people).
Develop and implement data pipelines that extracts, transforms and loads data into an information product that helps to inform the organization in reaching strategic goals.
Write high-quality code, conduct and participate in code reviews, and follow strong engineering principles and standards.
Research the technical feasibility of new ideas and actively suggest technology improvements.
Quickly develop a thorough understanding of the product, architecting the system and shipping production ready code.
Write maintainable code that can scale fast.
Support and contribute to our amazing work culture.


About You:


Deep experience & understanding of object-oriented design, design patterns, micro services architecture, data structure, algorithms and their complexities, and systems architecture
Skilled in writing and automating tests for your code
Proven working experience with cloud platforms.
Demonstrated experience with OLTP databases, specifically MySQL (understanding of day to day challenges related to query execution and optimization, e.g. indexing and cascading)
Working experience with big data aggregation frameworks (Spark)
Experience with streaming platforms like kafka and rabbitMQ
Experience working in an agile environment
Experience with C++ or any front-end framework is a plus
Excellent spoken and written communication skills in English


Big Data Skills:


3+ years of experience with writing code in Scala
Experience with Python, Spark, Airflow
Experience with Scala testing frameworks
Understanding of data-warehousing and data-modeling techniques
Proven experience with writing code for spark data processing
Familiarity with various OLAP data stores (Druid, Clickhouse etc) and their insights
Experience with at least one columnar OLAP databases
Familiarity with industry-standard analytics and visualization tools

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Customer Experience Analytics (all genders)
Description:
THE ROLE & THE TEAM


You will join the Customer Experience Analytics team. Our main goal is to delve deep into the customer experience, revealing its hidden elements. We are part of the customer care organisation, putting us in a unique position to understand and detect customer issues better and faster than any other team. We empower various teams across the entire organisation to tackle the hidden opportunities that we discover, ensuring a continuously improving experience for our customers. In this role, you will be instrumental in enhancing the CX insight platform, a pivotal asset that will be utilised to decode and enhance the customer experience comprehensively. Your contributions will not only shape our data landscape but also directly influence our ability to understand and elevate every customer interaction.


INCLUSIVE BY DESIGN


We only assess candidates based on qualifications, merit, and business needs. We welcome applications from people of all gender identities, sexual orientations, personal expressions, racial identities, ethnicities, religious beliefs, and disability statuses. We only want to know why you‚Äôre great for this role, so please avoid including your picture, age, and marital status in your CV as well.

We want to provide you with a great candidate experience. Please feel free to inform us of any accommodations you may need, so we can best support and assist you throughout the hiring process.

do.BETTER - our diversity & inclusion strategy https //corporate.zalando.com/en/diversity-inclusion

Our employee resource groups https //corporate.zalando.com/en/diversity-inclusion/our-employee-resource-groups


WHERE YOUR EXPERTISE IS NEEDED




Data Analysis and Insights Generation Utilize advanced analytical techniques to extract insights from large and complex datasets. Translate these insights into actionable recommendations to drive business growth and optimization.
Statistical Analysis Apply advanced statistical methods to identify trends, patterns, and relationships within data. Conduct hypothesis testing, regression analysis, and other statistical techniques to support data-driven decision-making.
Data Visualization and Reporting Develop visually compelling dashboards and reports to communicate key metrics and trends to stakeholders. Ensure that data visualisations are intuitive, informative, and tailored to the needs of different audience groups.
ETL Process Optimization Design and optimise ETL pipelines, ensuring data integrity and reliability throughout the data lifecycle.
Self-Service Analytics Enablement Develop self-service analytics tools and resources to empower stakeholders to access and analyse data independently. Provide training and support to enable users to leverage data effectively in their decision-making processes
Continuous Learning and Innovation Stay updated on emerging trends and technologies in data analytics. Proactively identify opportunities to innovate and enhance our analytical capabilities. Share knowledge and best practices with team members to foster a culture of continuous learning and improvement.




WE'D LOVE TO MEET YOU IF




You have a solid understanding of statistical principles and their application in data analysis.
You have strong expertise in SQL and Python. You have experience building and optimising data pipelines, as well as applying data modelling techniques to design datasets for Business Intelligence systems. You are familiar with Databricks Spark, AWS.
You are familiar with causal inference methods and their application in data analysis.
You are adept at tackling complex data challenges, possess strong analytical skills, and can devise efficient, scalable solutions.
You are experienced with data visualization tools.
You understand the importance of data quality and the implications that issues in data quality can trigger in other teams. At the same time, you understand the tradeoff between complexity and practicality and know when to favor one over the other in your solutions.
You excel in a collaborative environment, can articulate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders, and enjoy working in cross-functional teams.




OUR OFFER


Zalando provides a range of benefits, here‚Äôs an overview of what you can expect. Ask your Talent Acquisition Partner to learn more about what we offer.



Employee shares program
40% off fashion and beauty products sold and shipped by Zalando, 30% off Zalando Lounge, discounts from external partners
2 paid volunteering days a year
Hybrid working model with 60% (or more) remote per week, actual practice is up to each team to best support their collaboration
Work from abroad for up to 30 working days a year
27 days of vacation a year to start
Relocation assistance available (subject to prior agreement)
Family services, including counselling and support
Health and wellbeing options (including Gympass)
Mental health support and coaching available
Drive your development through our training platform and biannual peer-to-peer review.

Show more
