Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Requisition ID: 201024

Join a purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

The Team

Global Treasury Technology (GTT) provides technology support for business applications and related liquidity reporting. Its purpose driven winning team, committed to results, in an inclusive and high-performing culture.

The Role

GTT is searching for passionate business analyst who are continuous learners & passionate about big data systems and its analysis.

The successful candidate will have a strong passion for big data system analysis. You will work closely with business teams and cross functional engineering leaders to gather data requirements for the various big data & reporting projects within GTT.

As part of the role, you‚Äôll


Demonstrate an informed knowledge of business functions to resolve problems and capitalize on improvement opportunities.
Ensure business specifications/requirements documentation is accurately prepared and comprehensive to support sizing/development efforts and as input to various project documentation.
Develop and deliver Business Data Requirements Documents, Design Documents, Use Cases, and Process Models as required.
Participate in the development of detailed project plans, the monitoring of progress against planned objectives, the financial review, and securing consensus and co-operation from users and senior management.
Work closely across GTT technology teams during all stages of the system development life cycle and bridge the gap between business and technology sides of the solution.
Liaising between the business community and the IT organization to provide technical solutions that meet user needs.
Build relationships and communicate effectively with colleagues in Global regions.
Support production issues and handle escalations during Release cycles as needed.
Perform ad hoc project work on various GTT projects.
Participates in the support of the production and maintenance of the GTT platforms


Minimum Qualifications


Experience working across multiple teams and functions to ensure alignment.
2 years practical experience or relevant co-op experience in business analysis. Big data analysis would be an asset.
Minimum 2 years‚Äô working knowledge of databases & SQL, with ability to create and run queries independently.
Knowledge of Google Cloud such as big query or eagerness to self-learn.
Ability to adapt quickly to new processes and standards, with a strong commitment to providing exceptional customer service.
Proven ability to translate business data requirements into technical specifications and deliver working results.
Proven ability to draft test cases for functional and non-functional testing.
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills.
A recognized undergraduate degree or diploma in business administration, computer science or related field required.
Excellent working experience of Microsoft suite of products (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project).
Functional knowledge of treasury or financial domain would be an asset.


Preferred Qualifications


An understanding of the Bank‚Äôs application system and software from a business/technical viewpoint is required to assess the impact of development and/or changes to the overall data processing environment).
Experience supporting treasury applications is a plus.
Experience managing projects that span change in front, middle or back-office systems and teams.
Strong Experience with big data systems is an asset.


What's in it for you?


Diversity, Equity, Inclusion & Allyship - We strive to create an inclusive culture where every employee is empowered to reach their fullest potential, respected for who they are, and are embraced through bias-free practices and inclusive values across Scotiabank. We embrace diversity and provide opportunities for all employee to learn, grow & participate through our various Employee Resource Groups (ERGs) that span across diverse gender identities, ethnicity, race, age, ability & veterans.
Accessibility and Workplace Accommodations - We value the unique skills and experiences everyone brings to the Bank and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. Scotiabank continues to locate, remove, and prevent barriers so that we can build a diverse and inclusive environment while meeting accessibility requirements.
Hybrid-friendly work environment will provide you with the flexibility of best of both remote and in office world, to perform at your best.
Upskilling through online courses, cross-functional development opportunities, and tuition assistance.‚ÄØ
Competitive Rewards program including bonus, flexible vacation, personal, sick days and benefits will start on day one.
Community Engagement - no matter where you choose to work from; we offer opportunities for community engagement & belonging with our various programs such as hackathons, contests, cooking with friends, Humans of Digital and much more!


Location(s): Canada : Ontario : Toronto

Scotiabank is a leading bank in the Americas. Guided by our purpose: "for every future", we help our customers, their families and their communities achieve success through a broad range of advice, products and services, including personal and commercial banking, wealth management and private banking, corporate and investment banking, and capital markets.

At Scotiabank, we value the unique skills and experiences each individual brings to the Bank, and are committed to creating and maintaining an inclusive and accessible environment for everyone. If you require accommodation (including, but not limited to, an accessible interview site, alternate format documents, ASL Interpreter, or Assistive Technology) during the recruitment and selection process, please let our Recruitment team know. If you require technical assistance, please click here. Candidates must apply directly online to be considered for this role. We thank all applicants for their interest in a career at Scotiabank; however, only those candidates who are selected for an interview will be contacted.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Stripe

Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies‚Äîfrom the world‚Äôs largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups‚Äîuse Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone‚Äôs reach while doing the most important work of your career.

About The Team

Data Science at Stripe is a vibrant community where data analysts, data scientists and engineers learn and grow together. You will work with some of Stripe‚Äôs most fundamental and exciting data, and use that data to help drive company-wide initiatives. We have a variety of Data Analytics roles and teams across Stripe and will seek to align you to the most relevant team based on your background.

What you'll do

In this role, you will partner deeply with teams across Stripe to ensure that our users, our products, and our business have the models, data products, and insights needed to make decisions and grow responsibly. You will work closely with partners to extract insights from Stripe's rich and complex data. You will also work with leaders to translate business needs into data problems. You will build metrics, scalable data pipelines, dashboards, and reports to inform and run the business. You will deliver actionable business recommendations through analyses and data storytelling.

Who you are

We‚Äôre looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. The preferred qualifications are a bonus, not a requirement.

Minimum Requirements


2-8+ years experience in Business Intelligence Engineering, Data Engineering, Data Analysis or Data Science roles, building data pipelines and analyzing large datasets to solve problems
Proficiency in SQL and Python
Strong statistical knowledge
Expertise in visualization and using data insights to make recommendations and achieve goals
Proven ability to manage and deliver on multiple projects with great attention to detail
Ability to clearly communicate results and drive impact
Comfortable collaborating across functions to identify data analytics problems and execute solutions with technical rigor and data-driven insights.



Preferred Qualifications


Master‚Äôs degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Engineering, or a related technical field.
Prior experience at a growth stage internet or software company.
Experience with distributed data frameworks like Hadoop and Spark to write and debug data pipelines.
Good understanding of development processes and best practices like engineering standards, code reviews, and testing.



Hybrid work at Stripe

This role is available either in an office or a remote location (typically, 35+ miles or 56+ km from a Stripe office).

Office-assigned Stripes spend at least 50% of the time in a given month in their local office or with users. This hits a balance between bringing people together for in-person collaboration and learning from each other, while supporting flexibility about how to do this in a way that makes sense for individuals and their teams.

A remote location, in most cases, is defined as being 35 miles (56 kilometers) or more from one of our offices. While you would be welcome to come into the office for team/business meetings, on-sites, meet-ups, and events, our expectation is you would regularly work from home rather than a Stripe office. Stripe does not cover the cost of relocating to a remote location. We encourage you to apply for roles that match the location where you currently or plan to live.

Pay and benefits

The annual salary range for this role in the primary location is C$128,700 - C$221,900. This range may change if you are hired in another location. For sales roles, the range provided is the role‚Äôs On Target Earnings (‚ÄúOTE‚Äù) range, meaning that the range includes both the sales commissions/sales bonuses target and annual base salary for the role. This salary range may be inclusive of several career levels at Stripe and will be narrowed during the interview process based on a number of factors, including the candidate‚Äôs experience, qualifications, and specific location. Applicants interested in this role and who are not located in the primary location may request the annual salary range for their location during the interview process.

Specific benefits and details about what compensation is included in the salary range listed above will vary depending on the applicant‚Äôs location and can be discussed in more detail during the interview process. Benefits/additional compensation for this role may include: equity, company bonus or sales commissions/bonuses; retirement plans; health benefits; and wellness stipends.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Our client is a top financial institution with significant North American holdings. They have operations across most major verticals, including institutional & corporate, wealth management, private client, commercial banking, treasury, and retail banking.




Job Description

Position: Data Analyst II

Location Address: 100% remote ‚Äì open to candidates across Canada

Contract Duration: 7 months

Schedule Hours: 9am-5pm Monday-Friday; standard 37.5 hrs/week

Job Description:

The Admin Advantage team within the Group Benefits organization links people, technology and expert services to simplify benefits administration and provide a consistent, powerful member and client experience. Our vision is to be recognized as the partner of choice within the industry for benefits solutions and benefits administration services.

We are seeking a Data Analyst with proven relationship and strong technical and analytical skills to join the team on a regular full-time basis.

In this role, you will work through business impacts, articulate business requirements, define user acceptance testing requirements and provide support to many other processes and deliverables in the project life cycle. You will work to understand current state by obtaining information, with the right level of detail from many different stakeholder groups, subject matter experts, and technical resources. You will interact with various areas, including; Service Owners, Benefits Administrators and various levels of management in multiple locations.

As a member of the AdminAdvantage team you will be supporting large corporate clients, coordinating efforts to provide world class benefits administration and customer service. Our clients trust the administration of their group benefits to us and you will be part of a team that delivers outstanding results to those clients and our members.

Does this sound like you?

‚Ä¢ Data Analysis Experience

‚Ä¢ Conceptual Thinker (big picture)

‚Ä¢ Strong Negotiation & Influencing Skills

‚Ä¢ Action Oriented Problem Solver

‚Ä¢ Collaborative Team Player

‚Ä¢ Produce high quality deliverables on time

‚Ä¢ Excellent verbal and written communication skills

‚Ä¢ Flexible to Change (processes, tools, priorities etc.)

‚Ä¢ Resiliency with Ambiguity

Typical Day in Role

‚Ä¢ Identify impacts to our clients.

‚Ä¢ Accountable for end-to-end management of pre and post enrolment reporting analysis and updates.

‚Ä¢ Engage and collaborate with internal team members and stakeholders to provide status updates and resolve client issues.

‚Ä¢ Create the necessary handover documentation and transition the changes to the Service Owner for sign-off.

‚Ä¢ Contribute to enrolment project level deliverables

‚Ä¢ Work collaboratively with the AdminAdvantage RBA and Service Owner teams to pro-actively share information and foster continued learning and development

‚Ä¢ Look for ways to improve/ streamline the way we work and how we service our customers and stakeholders

Candidate Requirements/Must Have Skills:

1. Proficient in Microsoft intermediate/advanced Excel and SQL

2. Data Analyst - 2+ years‚Äô experience

3. Thorough knowledge of analysis

4. Infectiously positive personality with a drive to succeed and a dedication to quality service

5. Stellar customer service and skills that demonstrate integrity

6. Strong data analysis, decision-making ability with a real passion for solving problems

7. Superior attention to detail

Nice-To-Have Skills:

1. Proficiency in Microsoft Access and Visual Basic programming, Macros, VBA is an asset

2. Knowledge of Group Benefits as well as Benefits Administration would an asset

3. Good knowledge of Benefits Administration Systems (Vital Objects) would be an asset

4. Proven experience with learning new products, technologies and tools

Education:

‚Ä¢ Bachelor's degree is preferred

Additional Soft skills:

‚Ä¢ Proven negotiation and communication skills

‚Ä¢ Proven experience with MS Office suite of software

‚Ä¢ Ability to demonstrate confidence and resilience in every day situations

‚Ä¢ Good relationship management skills

‚Ä¢ Familiar with the various types of standard electronic files

‚Ä¢ Excellent listening and interpersonal skills

‚Ä¢ Exceptional time management and organizational skills

‚Ä¢ Can effectively communicate ideas and recommendations to all levels of the organization

‚Ä¢ Results oriented and can manage multiple priorities and projects

Our client is a top financial institution with significant North American holdings. They have operations across most major verticals, including institutional & corporate, wealth management, private client, commercial banking, treasury, and retail banking.


Job Description

Position: Data Analyst II

Location Address: 100% remote ‚Äì open to candidates across Canada

Contract Duration: 7 months

Schedule Hours: 9am-5pm Monday-Friday; standard 37.5 hrs/week

Job Description:

The Admin Advantage team within the Group Benefits organization links people, technology and expert services to simplify benefits administration and provide a consistent, powerful member and client experience. Our vision is to be recognized as the partner of choice within the industry for benefits solutions and benefits administration services.

We are seeking a Data Analyst with proven relationship and strong technical and analytical skills to join the team on a regular full-time basis.

In this role, you will work through business impacts, articulate business requirements, define user acceptance testing requirements and provide support to many other processes and deliverables in the project life cycle. You will work to understand current state by obtaining information, with the right level of detail from many different stakeholder groups, subject matter experts, and technical resources. You will interact with various areas, including; Service Owners, Benefits Administrators and various levels of management in multiple locations.

As a member of the AdminAdvantage team you will be supporting large corporate clients, coordinating efforts to provide world class benefits administration and customer service. Our clients trust the administration of their group benefits to us and you will be part of a team that delivers outstanding results to those clients and our members.

Does this sound like you?

‚Ä¢ Data Analysis Experience

‚Ä¢ Conceptual Thinker (big picture)

‚Ä¢ Strong Negotiation & Influencing Skills

‚Ä¢ Action Oriented Problem Solver

‚Ä¢ Collaborative Team Player

‚Ä¢ Produce high quality deliverables on time

‚Ä¢ Excellent verbal and written communication skills

‚Ä¢ Flexible to Change (processes, tools, priorities etc.)

‚Ä¢ Resiliency with Ambiguity

Typical Day in Role

‚Ä¢ Identify impacts to our clients.

‚Ä¢ Accountable for end-to-end management of pre and post enrolment reporting analysis and updates.

‚Ä¢ Engage and collaborate with internal team members and stakeholders to provide status updates and resolve client issues.

‚Ä¢ Create the necessary handover documentation and transition the changes to the Service Owner for sign-off.

‚Ä¢ Contribute to enrolment project level deliverables

‚Ä¢ Work collaboratively with the AdminAdvantage RBA and Service Owner teams to pro-actively share information and foster continued learning and development

‚Ä¢ Look for ways to improve/ streamline the way we work and how we service our customers and stakeholders

Candidate Requirements/Must Have Skills:

1. Proficient in Microsoft intermediate/advanced Excel and SQL

2. Data Analyst - 2+ years‚Äô experience

3. Thorough knowledge of analysis

4. Infectiously positive personality with a drive to succeed and a dedication to quality service

5. Stellar customer service and skills that demonstrate integrity

6. Strong data analysis, decision-making ability with a real passion for solving problems

7. Superior attention to detail

Nice-To-Have Skills:

1. Proficiency in Microsoft Access and Visual Basic programming, Macros, VBA is an asset

2. Knowledge of Group Benefits as well as Benefits Administration would an asset

3. Good knowledge of Benefits Administration Systems (Vital Objects) would be an asset

4. Proven experience with learning new products, technologies and tools

Education:

‚Ä¢ Bachelor's degree is preferred

Additional Soft skills:

‚Ä¢ Proven negotiation and communication skills

‚Ä¢ Proven experience with MS Office suite of software

‚Ä¢ Ability to demonstrate confidence and resilience in every day situations

‚Ä¢ Good relationship management skills

‚Ä¢ Familiar with the various types of standard electronic files

‚Ä¢ Excellent listening and interpersonal skills

‚Ä¢ Exceptional time management and organizational skills

‚Ä¢ Can effectively communicate ideas and recommendations to all levels of the organization

‚Ä¢ Results oriented and can manage multiple priorities and projects

‚Ä¢ Ability to take initiative and demonstrate good judgement

‚Ä¢ Solid collaboration skills with the ability to work autonomously

‚Ä¢ Ability to work in a demanding environment

Best vs. Average: a stand out candidate would be someone with an entrepreneurial spirt ‚Äì can hit the ground running, self-sufficient, and self -starter. They are joining a team that is quickly growing and changing and need to be able to adapt and be flexible

Additional Notes

‚Ä¢ Any additional details to share with Suppliers (i.e. team/cultural fit, professional background preference, etc.) ‚Äì someone who can be flexible, embrace change and adapt to changing environment

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
About Stripe

Stripe is a financial infrastructure platform for businesses. Millions of companies‚Äîfrom the world‚Äôs largest enterprises to the most ambitious startups‚Äîuse Stripe to accept payments, grow their revenue, and accelerate new business opportunities. Our mission is to increase the GDP of the internet, and we have a staggering amount of work ahead. That means you have an unprecedented opportunity to put the global economy within everyone‚Äôs reach while doing the most important work of your career.

About The Team

Data Science at Stripe is a vibrant community where data analysts, data scientists and engineers learn and grow together. You will work with some of Stripe‚Äôs most fundamental and exciting data, and use that data to help drive company-wide initiatives. We have a variety of Data Analytics roles and teams across Stripe and will seek to align you to the most relevant team based on your background.

What you'll do

In this role, you will partner deeply with teams across Stripe to ensure that our users, our products, and our business have the models, data products, and insights needed to make decisions and grow responsibly. You will work closely with partners to extract insights from Stripe's rich and complex data. You will also work with leaders to translate business needs into data problems. You will build metrics, scalable data pipelines, dashboards, and reports to inform and run the business. You will deliver actionable business recommendations through analyses and data storytelling.

Who you are

We‚Äôre looking for someone who meets the minimum requirements to be considered for the role. If you meet these requirements, you are encouraged to apply. The preferred qualifications are a bonus, not a requirement.

Minimum Requirements


2-8+ years experience in Business Intelligence Engineering, Data Engineering, Data Analysis or Data Science roles, building data pipelines and analyzing large datasets to solve problems
Proficiency in SQL and Python
Strong statistical knowledge
Expertise in visualization and using data insights to make recommendations and achieve goals
Proven ability to manage and deliver on multiple projects with great attention to detail
Ability to clearly communicate results and drive impact
Comfortable collaborating across functions to identify data analytics problems and execute solutions with technical rigor and data-driven insights.



Preferred Qualifications


Master‚Äôs degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Engineering, or a related technical field.
Prior experience at a growth stage internet or software company.
Experience with distributed data frameworks like Hadoop and Spark to write and debug data pipelines.
Good understanding of development processes and best practices like engineering standards, code reviews, and testing.



Hybrid work at Stripe

This role is available either in an office or a remote location (typically, 35+ miles or 56+ km from a Stripe office).

Office-assigned Stripes spend at least 50% of the time in a given month in their local office or with users. This hits a balance between bringing people together for in-person collaboration and learning from each other, while supporting flexibility about how to do this in a way that makes sense for individuals and their teams.

A remote location, in most cases, is defined as being 35 miles (56 kilometers) or more from one of our offices. While you would be welcome to come into the office for team/business meetings, on-sites, meet-ups, and events, our expectation is you would regularly work from home rather than a Stripe office. Stripe does not cover the cost of relocating to a remote location. We encourage you to apply for roles that match the location where you currently or plan to live.

Pay and benefits

The annual salary range for this role in the primary location is C$128,700 - C$221,900. This range may change if you are hired in another location. For sales roles, the range provided is the role‚Äôs On Target Earnings (‚ÄúOTE‚Äù) range, meaning that the range includes both the sales commissions/sales bonuses target and annual base salary for the role. This salary range may be inclusive of several career levels at Stripe and will be narrowed during the interview process based on a number of factors, including the candidate‚Äôs experience, qualifications, and specific location. Applicants interested in this role and who are not located in the primary location may request the annual salary range for their location during the interview process.

Specific benefits and details about what compensation is included in the salary range listed above will vary depending on the applicant‚Äôs location and can be discussed in more detail during the interview process. Benefits/additional compensation for this role may include: equity, company bonus or sales commissions/bonuses; retirement plans; health benefits; and wellness stipends.

Title: ICQA Data Analyst
Description:
Description

At Amazon, we're working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people. If you'd like to help us build the place to find and buy anything online, this is your chance to make history. Amazon Canada Fulfillment Services is hiring a Data Analyst to support the Inventory Control / Quality Assurance (ICQA) team. The Data Analyst assigned to ICQA will work closely with the ICQA and operations teams in Inbound and Outbound to provide data and analytical support for ACES initiatives, root cause investigation of defects, and will provide support to ensure compliance to ICQA-related SoX requirements. The Data Analyst will own the insights, set up analysis, and create automated dashboards and reporting. They will be responsible for identifying data sources (internal / external) to invent and simplify mechanisms and create custom reporting and analytics automation tools. Operating in a fast-moving and sometimes ambiguous environment, you will be required to work autonomously, taking full control and responsibility for achieving business objectives. This role provides real opportunity to develop original ideas, approaches and solutions in an ever-changing and competitive business climate.

Key job responsibilities


Development of data collection processes and data management systems
Maintenance of data integrity (0% error rate)
Designing of queries, compiling of data, and generation of reports in MS Excel
Charting and graphing of data for reporting purposes
In depth research of defect trends
Data collection and entry as needed
Data mining and problem solving
Back up for Process Assistant duties


Basic Qualifications


2+ years of professional or military experience
Experience with Microsoft Office products and applications


Preferred Qualifications


Experience with end-to-end project management


Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status. If you would like to request an accommodation, please notify your Recruiter.

Title: Analyst, Data Solutions
Description:
About Klick Health

Meet a different kind of workplace. Klick Health is an ecosystem of brilliant minds working to realize the full potential of their people and clients in life sciences since 1997. And we‚Äôre still growing fast, even after two decades. What does that mean for you? As Klick experiences exponential growth year-over-year, so do the people who help make it happen. Because we‚Äôre constantly evolving and changing, we invest in talent early and often, to develop future leaders at all levels. We‚Äôre one of the country‚Äôs Top 10 Great Workplaces, 10 Most Inspiring Cultures, Best Workplace for Innovators, Best Managed, and Fastest Growing. We know that career paths are seldom simple and straightforward. And that's an asset. If you feel like you'd be a good fit for this role, we encourage you to apply and take the first steps to starting your career journey at Klick!

As part of our Analytics team, you'll be at the forefront of the big data revolution, guiding marketing strategies for our diverse range of clients. If you're ready to unleash your creativity and expertise in a fast-paced environment, we invite you to embark on your career journey with us at Klick.

As an integral part of our forward-thinking team, you'll collaborate closely with top-tier professionals to design, develop, and maintain cutting-edge data solutions. Embrace the challenge of handling growing datasets and navigating the ever-evolving media landscape, all while pushing the boundaries of digital transformation.

This role isn't just about crunching numbers ‚Äì it's about driving real impact by merging data solutions into client engagements and marketing sciences products. You'll work hand-in-hand with stakeholders to craft tailored solutions that meet our clients' unique needs, all while showcasing your expertise in both individual and team settings. Your code will serve as the bedrock of our service offering, ensuring optimal performance and maintenance of our systems.

But it's not just about technical prowess ‚Äì we're seeking individuals with insatiable curiosity, a drive to challenge the status quo, and a passion for uncovering insights that drive real change. If you're ready to dive deep, tackle complex challenges, and share your discoveries with peers and clients alike, then come join us on the forefront of analytics innovation. At Klick, your love for data will be celebrated and your potential truly unleashed.

Responsibilities:


Work in a collaborative manner and Interact with other analytic team members, Data Analysts, Project Managers, and Business Analysts to learn project data needs and define project scope
Design, develop, optimize, and maintain data architecture and pipelines that adhere to ETL principles and business goals (Python and SQL)
Maintain enterprise data warehouse (Snowflake preferred but not required)
Build analytic products in the form of presentations, data outputs, system integrations, business intelligence platforms, and AI outputs
Foster a culture of sharing, re-use, design for scale stability, and operational efficiency of code, queries, and data engineering processes (Git Management, SOP creation, Requirement Maintenance)



Qualifications:


4-5 years‚Äô of hands-on practical experience with a minimum of 2 years‚Äô of experience in ETL processing to be used for data analysis and modeling
Minimum 2 years of working knowledge in Python and SQL is a must
Experience working with clickstream data sets and data lakes is a must
Ability to gather requirements from non technical stakeholders and clients
Experience with Business Intelligence platforms such as Power BI, Microsoft Fabric, and Tableau



Bonus Points!


Healthcare experience
Post-secondary education in computer science
Demonstrate working knowledge in database design and management



Klick is consciously creating a culture where everyone can thrive and grow in their careers. We believe that our best work comes from our diverse backgrounds, perspectives, and skills. We strongly encourage members of historically underrepresented communities to apply, including Black people, Indigenous peoples, and other people of colour, people with disabilities, people from gender and sexually diverse communities and people with intersectional identities.

We‚Äôre also committed to developing an inclusive, barrier-free recruitment process and work environment. Should you require any accommodation, please contact us at careers@klick.com and we will work with you to meet your accessibility needs and ensure you have a positive experience.

Title: Inventory Data Analyst
Description:
Leavitt Machinery‚ÄØis one of the fastest growing material handling equipment dealerships in North America. With an entrepreneurial spirit, mission-driven approach, and customer-focused mindset, Leavitt has achieved consistent growth over the past 25 years.

Leavitt Machinery is now an integral entity within the Venturis group of companies, an integrated and expanding network of businesses, including over 60+ branches and 1400+ employees across Canada and the USA. Venturis Capital strategically invests in visionary and values-driven organizations, with expertise in the material handling equipment industry.

In addition to our expanding dealership network, the Venturis portfolio includes complementary companies providing financing, freight and logistics, parts manufacturing, industrial parts supply, component rebuilding, training solutions, and marketing.

With a focus on learning and continuous improvement, we are proud to invest in our people and offer a progressive and flexible work culture where you can develop and advance your career while focusing on meaningful work.

The Opportunity

Leavitt Machinery is looking for an Inventory Data Analyst to join our team in Coquitlam, BC. As the Inventory Data Analyst, you will partner with stakeholders to ensure their needs are met by the Parts department, while capitalizing on opportunities to drive business success.

Essential Duties & Responsibilities

As the Inventory Data Analyst your key responsibilities will include:


Manage and monitor inventory levels to ensure optimal inventory
Conduct periodic inventory audits to ensure accuracy
Perform cycle counts and reconcile discrepancies
Coordinate and support annual count of all inventories
Analyze inventory data to identify trends, forecast needs, and optimize inventory levels
Generate and present reports on inventory levels, usage rates, and forecasted needs
Track key performance indicators (KPIs) related to inventory management
Use historical data to identify demand patterns and adjust inventory levels accordingly
Work with Sales and Operations teams to understand future demand and plan inventory needs
Identify and implement process improvements to enhance inventory management efficiency
Leverage inventory management software and other technologies to streamline operations
Analyze inventory-related costs and identify areas for cost reduction
Ensure compliance with all relevant regulations and standards
Maintain safe inventory storage practices and ensure adherence to safety standards
Provide support to internal teams by ensuring the availability of required parts
Ensure all inventory-related documentation is complete and accurate


Required Skills & Qualifications

The ideal candidate will possess the following skills, knowledge, and competencies:


Bachelor's degree in supply chain management, business administration, or a related field preferred
Prior experience in inventory management or a related field
Familiarization with Lean concepts & principles will be considered a strong asset
Previous experience with Microsoft Dynamics ERP is considered an asset
Advanced skills in Excel, including pivot tables, VLOOKUP, macros, and data visualization
Experience with tools such as SQL, Tableau, and Power BI for creating detailed reports
Excellent communication skills, organizational skills, and analytical skills
Ability to manage multiple priorities in parallel and excel in a fast-paced work environment
High level of accuracy and attention to detail


Benefits & Perks

Leavitt Machinery Canada is proud to offer competitive compensation and flexible benefits coverage for all eligible employees, including an employer matching RRSP plan:


Company paid medical health care plan for you and your dependents
Extended health plan ‚Äì 100% employer paid
Dental plan, vision plan, and prescription drug coverage
Annual health care spending account
Life insurance, disability insurance, and travel insurance ‚Äì 100% employer paid
Sick leave plan ‚Äì 100% employer paid
Employee assistance programs
RRSP matching
Wellness days
Ongoing professional development opportunities


The base pay range for this role is: $50,000-$70,000 annually, depending on experience.

This is an onsite role based in Coquitlam, BC.

Leavitt Machinery & Venturis would like to thank all applicants for their interest, however, only qualified applicants will be contacted by Talent Acquisition for an interview. We are an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, veteran status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Client: Retail IT




Job Description:

As an integral member of our organization, the Data Analyst will work with a team of Data Scientists, Product management and Business teams to collect project requirements, identify data, build queries, develop ML models and present findings.

Responsibilities:

Coordinate data conversations with stakeholders, data sources
Explore and analyze complex datasets to identify patterns and anomalies (SQL, Python)
Develop and deploy machine learning model.
Work with business to understand logic
Lead data analytics process with the product team to gather insights and identify solutions
Collect, organize, analyze, and present insights.
Organize project steps and document questions, findings, processes (confluence, JIRA)

Key Qualifications:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related technical field
2+ years of experience as a data analyst
Experience with SQL, Python, Confluence, Jira
Able to identify source systems and data steward
Able to write and run SQL queries from Data Lake, Big Query, and Vendor Master as required
Experienced in JIRA , scrum ceremonies, and Agile Methodology
Strong SQL skills and experience working with large datasets

Nice To Have:

Familiarity with anomaly detection and a variety of ML models and algorithms
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail
Curiosity and a passion for exploring and understanding complex datasets
Strong communication skills

Title: Jr. Data Analyst
Description:
Description

The Data Analyst will be responsible for ingesting, cleaning, and processing data from multiple sources. The ideal candidate will have proficiency in Python or R, as well as experience with data visualization tools, including AWS QuickSight. This role involves supporting the dashboard team by ensuring data integrity and creating compelling data visualizations.


Ingest and clean data from various sources to ensure accuracy and consistency.
Utilize Python or R to perform data processing tasks.
Work with data visualization tools, specifically AWS QuickSight, to create insightful and actionable visual representations of data.
Collaborate with the dashboard team to support their data needs and contribute to the development of data stories.
Ensure data quality and integrity throughout the processing stages.
Assist in the maintenance and enhancement of data pipelines and workflows.


Requirements


Proficiency in Python or R for data processing and analysis.
Experience with data visualization tools, particularly AWS QuickSight

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Business Intelligence Analyst




About PointsBet




Originally founded in the mature sports wagering market of Australia, PointsBet is one of the fastest growing operators in the industry. Our growth is driven by our continued investment in our proprietary gaming platform. Our in-house approach to technology powers innovative and personalized customer experiences that has driven our success. In addition to our leading sports platform, we have a growing competitive digital casino business that allows PointsBet Canada to serve customers with a full suite of gaming experiences.




We believe in the power of fandom and have partnered with leading sports organizations to provide both our customers and team members access to truly unique sporting experiences. In Canada we are the official partner of the Toronto Maple Leafs, the Toronto Raptors, the Toronto FC, the Toronto Argonauts and the Ottawa Red Blacks, Curling Canada, and Clublink Canada.




PointsBet Canada is a fast paced, dynamic and rapidly growing business. We have built a culture of high performance by ensuring our employees are able to contribute fully, are well supported, and encouraged to be their authentic selves. If you are in search of a new opportunity that values people, creativity, opportunity, results, and a commitment to excellence, then PointsBet is where you want to be!




About this Opportunity

Reporting to the Business Intelligence Manager, the Business Intelligence Analyst delivers reporting solutions to different business stakeholders to help them with their processes. Alongside with the rest of the Business Intelligence team, you will bridge the gap between the technical environment of different data sources and the set of requirements the business needs through impactful and easy to understand reports.




Responsibilities:

Develop operational and analytical reports, dashboards, datasets, and another reporting tools for various departments.
Extract, interpret, and present data to build business insights using SQL and Power BI
Communicate insights to business stakeholders in a manner that aids and informs their decision making.
Become an expert in the data and information of digital wagering.
Assist users to define, clarify, and document reporting and analytical requirements.
Build and maintain a strong documentation repository for all BI related works.
Perform data mining and/or scraping as the business need requires.




Requirements:

Organized approach to documentation. Should be able to effectively translate specific events or actions taken into a well-organized, easy to understand document.
Good experience in multitasking and adapting inside a dynamic business environment.
Intermediate to expert level in MS Excel
Experience in querying data using T-SQL and developing Power BI reports is a plus.
Post secondary education is required.




Perks and Benefits

Competitive Benefits Package
Paid Volunteer Days
EAP Program Access
Social Events (sporting events, concerts, happy hours, holiday parties, team outings)
RRSP Matching Program
A welcoming environment filled with opportunity and positive energy




Important Information




PointsBet Canada views responsible gambling not only as an ethical responsibility but as an important part of a sustainable business model. We‚Äôre proud to be recognized as a socially responsible operator committed to integrating responsible gambling resources and tools throughout the entire player journey.




PointsBet Canada is an equal opportunity employer, committed to inclusion and diversity. PointsBet Canada does not discriminate based on race, national or ethnic origin, colour, religion, age, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, marital status, family status, genetic characteristics, disability or any other basis forbidden under federal, provincial, or local law.




Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the recruitment process. If you require accommodation, or require recruitment documents in an alternative format, please contact us at can-hr@pointsbet.com.

Title: Business Analyst/Data Analyst
Description:
In this dynamic role, you will be responsible for client data ingestion, ensuring seamless integration of external client data to enhance our analytics capabilities and provide valuable insights to our stakeholders. Join us in our data-driven journey.

About The Role

As a Business Analyst, you'll be at the forefront of transforming raw data into actionable insights and innovative products. With a keen eye for detail and passion for problem solving, you'll play a pivotal role in shaping the company's data strategy and driving business success

In This Role, Your Key Business Responsibilities Will Include


Identify data product opportunities, including new products and product enhancements, through design thinking sessions and stakeholder engagement
Collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders, such as Technical Accounting, Experience Studies, Valuation, and Inforce Optimization, to gather and document product requirements
Translate product requirements into clear and actionable user stories or product specifications
Develop and implement tactical data products using available tools and support user onboarding
Develop and maintain key metrics to measure product success
Understand L&H Re systems and processes to advise and assist IT in system enhancements and migrating tactical products into strategic ones
Design, map, and code complex and unique client data setups


About The Team

The Data Management & Insights [DMI] team is part of Business Excellence delivering on the promise of a stable end-to-end operating platform for Life & Health Reinsurance [L&H Re]. Their mission is to make client data accessible to stakeholders by systematically acquiring and ingesting it. The team utilizes advanced analytics techniques to generate valuable insights for L&H Re. With a continuous improvement mindset, they strive to enhance data, systems, and processes for both their own use and their stakeholders.

About You

You have proven strategic, analytical, and conceptual thinking abilities. You have effective communication skills, with the ability to present complex data and insights to stakeholders clearly and concisely.

Essential Skills


Bachelor of Science degree with 5+ years of relevant experience
Proficient in data mapping, ETL processing, and data integration
Strong understanding of data structures and testing methodologies for onboarding large and complex client datasets
Proficient in SQL, Python/R coding


Nice To Have


Good understanding of relational databases, such as Oracle and SQL Server
Experience in handling large volumes of structured and unstructured data
Familiarity with best practices of data management and governance
Experience working in Waterfall and Agile projects, while leading projects being a plus
Hands-on experience with Data Integration tools (e.g. Palantir) and techniques (e.g. EDA, predictive & prescriptive analysis), and visualization software such as Power BI


Our company has a hybrid work model where the expectation is that you will be in the office two to three days per week on average.

This role will be unable to offer any assistance with relocation or visa sponsorship.

About Swiss Re

Swiss Re is one of the world‚Äôs leading providers of reinsurance, insurance and other forms of insurance-based risk transfer, working to make the world more resilient. We anticipate and manage a wide variety of risks, from natural catastrophes and climate change to cybercrime. We cover both Property & Casualty and Life & Health. Combining experience with creative thinking and cutting-edge expertise, we create new opportunities and solutions for our clients. This is possible thanks to the collaboration of more than 14,000 employees across the world.

Our success depends on our ability to build an inclusive culture encouraging fresh perspectives and innovative thinking. We embrace a workplace where everyone has equal opportunities to thrive and develop professionally regardless of their age, gender, race, ethnicity, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, physical or mental ability, skillset, thought or other characteristics. In our inclusive and flexible environment everyone can bring their authentic selves to work and their passion for sustainability.

Swiss Re is an equal opportunity employer. It is our practice to recruit, hire and promote without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, disability, age, pregnancy, sexual orientations, marital status, military status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Decisions on employment are solely based on an individual's qualifications for the position being filled.

During the recruitment process, reasonable accommodations for disabilities are available upon request. If contacted for an interview, please inform the Recruiter/HR Professional of the accommodation needed.

Title: ICQA Data Analyst
Description:
Description

At Amazon, we're working to be the most customer-centric company on earth. To get there, we need exceptionally talented, bright, and driven people. If you'd like to help us build the place to find and buy anything online, this is your chance to make history. Amazon Canada Fulfillment Services is hiring a Data Analyst to support the Inventory Control / Quality Assurance (ICQA) team. The Data Analyst assigned to ICQA will work closely with the ICQA and operations teams in Inbound and Outbound to provide data and analytical support for ACES initiatives, root cause investigation of defects, and will provide support to ensure compliance to ICQA-related SoX requirements. The Data Analyst will own the insights, set up analysis, and create automated dashboards and reporting. They will be responsible for identifying data sources (internal / external) to invent and simplify mechanisms and create custom reporting and analytics automation tools. Operating in a fast-moving and sometimes ambiguous environment, you will be required to work autonomously, taking full control and responsibility for achieving business objectives. This role provides real opportunity to develop original ideas, approaches and solutions in an ever-changing and competitive business climate.

Key job responsibilities


Development of data collection processes and data management systems
Maintenance of data integrity (0% error rate)
Designing of queries, compiling of data, and generation of reports in MS Excel
Charting and graphing of data for reporting purposes
In depth research of defect trends
Data collection and entry as needed
Data mining and problem solving
Back up for Process Assistant duties


Basic Qualifications


2+ years of professional or military experience
Experience with Microsoft Office products and applications


Preferred Qualifications


Experience with end-to-end project management

Amazon is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or other legally protected status. Title: Data analyst intern
Description:
Company Description

American Iron & Metal (AIM) is a family-owned company and recognized global leader in the metal recycling industry with more than 125 sites and 4000 employees worldwide. We have continued to prosper for the last eight decades thanks to the dedication of our employees and the ongoing trust and support of our customers.

Become part of team AIM, a growing team with an entrepreneurial spirit who has over the years evolved into a successful and multifaceted company with business divisions that include metal recycling, decommissioning and demolition, auto-parts sales and recycling, manufacturing of solder assemblies, construction waste recycling, and production of customized industrial and mining products.

We take pride in doing good things for the environment to help create a greener, more sustainable future for all.

It‚Äôs simple; we do it right. We AIM for excellence.

What we offer!


3 months paid internship
Free on-site gym.
Two on-site cafeterias (subsidized meal program available).
Dynamic and rewarding work environment - work on important and meaningful projects while having fun!


Job Description

We are seeking a motivated and detail-oriented intern to join our team as a Data Analyst Intern. In this role, you will work closely with our Maximo system, which is used for asset management and maintenance. Your primary responsibility will be to clean and enhance data within the Maximo database, ensuring its accuracy and reliability.

Responsibilities:

Data Analysis:


Review and analyze data within the Maximo system.
Identify inconsistencies, errors, and duplicates.
Correct data entries, standardize formats, and remove irrelevant information.
Collaborate with other team members to validate data changes.


Excel and Access:


Utilize Microsoft Excel and Access to manipulate and transform data.
Create and execute queries to extract relevant information.
Develop macros or scripts to automate data cleaning processes.
Ensure data integrity during import/export between Maximo and Excel/Access.


Documentation:


Maintain clear documentation of data cleansing procedures.
Record any issues encountered and their resolutions.
Document best practices for future reference.
Quality Assurance:
Validate the accuracy of cleaned data.
Perform data validation checks to ensure consistency.
Assist in testing data migration processes.


Collaboration:


Work closely with Maximo administrators and other team members.
Participate in team meetings and contribute insights on data quality improvement.


Qualifications


Currently pursuing a degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
Proficiency in Microsoft Excel and Access.
Strong attention to detail and analytical skills.
Ability to follow data cleansing guidelines and procedures.
Excellent communication and teamwork skills.


Additional Information


Full time (40h)


American Iron & Metal and its subsidiaries is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants are given consideration regardless of race, religion, colour, gender, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, marital status, citizenship status, disability, veteran status, or any other protected class as provided in applicable employment laws.‚ÄØ

Although we‚Äôd love to be able to speak with everyone that applies, due to the volume of applicants we receive and time constraints, only those selected to move forward will be contacted.‚ÄØ

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Description

A global leader in advancing aviation safety and optimizing operational efficiency through cutting-edge technology is expanding its dynamic team of 40+ professionals. Renowned as a high-tech company and seasoned subject-matter experts in flight data analysis technologies, we are seeking a talented individual to fill the role of DATA ANALYST, SPECIAL PROJECTS.

Duties

As a Data Analyst, you will leverage data science techniques and tools to collect, process, analyze, and visualize extensive datasets. The primary objective of this position is to derive insights and solutions that enhance safety, efficiency, and profitability within the aviation industry. Key responsibilities and tasks for this role include:


Collaborate with domain experts, engineers, and business stakeholders to comprehend aviation industry challenges and objectives, defining data requirements and specifications.
Utilize Python-based tools to acquire, clean, transform, and integrate data from diverse sources, including flight data recorders, air traffic control, weather, navigation, and maintenance systems.
Develop and deploy data products and solutions, such as dashboards, reports, models, or algorithms, to offer actionable insights and recommendations for the aviation sector.
Communicate and present data analysis results and findings to both technical and non-technical audiences, employing data visualization techniques and tools like Bokeh and Power BI.
Conduct research and experiments to explore innovative data sources, methods, and technologies to enhance flight data analysis capabilities.
Present work at conferences and trade shows.
Ensure the security, integrity, and confidentiality of all data and documents.
Maintain a high level of discretion and confidentiality.
Perform other duties as assigned.


If you are passionate about leveraging data to drive innovation in aviation and meet these qualifications, we invite you to join our dynamic team and contribute to shaping the future of aviation safety and efficiency.

Requirements

Qualifications / Experience:


Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Mathematics, Computer Science, or Physics.
Strong programming skills with detailed experience in Python.
Understanding of aircraft performance and aviation safety principles, or the ability to quickly acquire this knowledge.


Asset


Familiarity with Flight Data Analysis (FDA) principles and applications.
Experience with PowerBi and Bokeh.
Experience with Machine Learning frameworks.
Experience with Sensor Fusion methods.
Familiarity with aircraft data recording systems (A717, A767, etc.).

Job ID: A2684542

Title: Data Analyst - Canada
Description:
Undertone sits at the intersection of creative, data, and distribution, delivering award-winning creative experiences for the world's leading brands. Through our synchronized digital branding solution, we deliver cohesive stories that reach consumers across the most important touchpoints, screens, and platforms. We eliminate fragmentation and ensure brand messaging is synchronized and perfectly aligned with campaign KPIs‚Äîalways with beautiful creative and in brand-safe environments.

As member of the Undertone's UDMS Team, the Data Analyst drives value by providing provocative, differentiating analytics and insights. This position will support a wide variety of business intelligence efforts across Undertone while working in a highly collaborative manner within multiple large, cloud-based data sources to identify insights and spearhead our next generation product offerings. Most importantly, you should "love" the data, working with data, finding the nuance that leads to key differentiation for the business and our customers. This is a high visibility analytics and consulting position requiring daily interaction with business users, data scientists, engineers and key stakeholders.

Job Responsibilities:


Work with business teams to understand their analytical needs, including identifying critical metrics and KPIs
Use analytical and problem-solving skills to deliver actionable insights to relevant decision makers
Develop rich interactive visualizations integrating various reporting components from multiple data sources
Use SQL, Tableau and other technologies to pull data from different backend systems and product meaningful information and visualizations
Take complicated problems and build simple frameworks
Work directly with users and management to gather requirements, provide status updates, and build good relationships and rapport


Profile and Experience:


A minimum of 4 year of a full-time data analytics experience, ideally in an Ad-tech company
A minimum of a Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Mathematics, Business, or related field
Expert SQL coding skills against large data sets
Strong analytical skills, including the ability to mine data in order to draw meaningful conclusions
Strong oral and written communications skills
Knowledge of Business Intelligence tools such as Tableau


Undertone is committed to building a company whose staff reflects the true diversity of our community. Our employees are hired, promoted, and rewarded on the basis of talent, performance, dedication and results. We embrace our diversity and are proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer that welcomes all candidates without regard to race, creed, color, religion, national origin, alienage or citizenship status, sex, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, partnership status, ancestry, disability or veteran status.

Title: Business Data Analyst, Reporting & Audit
Description:
PartnerRe is a leading, privately owned, multi-line global reinsurer with a reputation of financial stability and strength, and a commitment to rebuilding businesses and communities after risk events around the world.

Our mission is to continue to be a financially stable and predictable business partner, supporting our clients with solutions tailored to their needs, delivering superior returns to our owner, providing rewarding opportunities for our people and making a positive contribution to society. To achieve this, we live by our values of Integrity, Performance, Collaboration, Straightforward Communication and Respect and Care.

Core to The PartnerRe Experience is our global nature. No matter where you sit in the company, you are part of something bigger. Our teams represent our truly international mindset, forging connections across office locations and all levels of the organization and building a network of mutual success. The result is a day-to-day experience that will allow you to:

Shape your own career

Grow in a supportive environment

Connect with a community of experts

Make an impact

View Home - PartnerRe Experience e-book to find out more about what it‚Äôs like to work at PartnerRe.

We are always looking for bright, proactive individuals to join our team!

Please follow our Careers page for all updates on new positions. We look forward to receiving your application.

PartnerRe is an equal opportunities employer.

Please join our company LinkedIn Page for all updates on new positions that are coming live.



Job Description



About this job:

The Business Data Analyst will be responsible for the analysis and validation of data files for processing in PartnerRe systems. Data may come in various file formats but usually includes transaction, in force, valuation and underwriting files, which have process streams that vary by function.

Participate in client visits or client audits (desk or on-site).
Provide support during internal/external audits.
Ensure monthly data loads continue to meet stated metrics. Responsibilities include data/plan mapping (including entry and verification of manual data loads) for all clients, investigation and resolution of client issues, and accounting loads/verification.
Develop a robust understanding of reinsurance concepts, principles and treaty language.
Respond to ad-hoc reporting requests from internal stakeholders.
Identify opportunities for process improvement, initiate internal reports and create efficiencies to improve data quality.
Assist other teams within North American Life Operations and Administration when necessary.
Assist internal stakeholders with requests for data, data inquiries, analyze any data discrepancies with supporting documentation.
Analyze and design management reporting as defined by management.
Write VBA code, macros, and SQL queries to extract, manipulate, and distribute data.
Communicate with clients to facilitate transmission of monthly data files and address any questions/clarifications regarding data issues with clients.
Verify that premiums, allowances and taxes for client policies being assumed are being calculated and billed correctly.
Update accounting system with monthly client cashflow accounts vs accounts receivable. Find and correct any discrepancies.
Adhere to all IT controls and security established by IT management.
Adhere to all SOX controls as defined by Internal Control Framework
Create and maintain a rigorous and effective control environment. This includes complying with all existing controls and identifying and remediating gaps in our current controls.
Follow IT change management process by thoroughly testing all ETL scripts and CRM applications prior to changes to be implemented.
Liaise with Underwriting for data checking, management reporting, and discussion on results from Audits and for Retro business (including facultative applications).
Assist with Enhancement Projects including creation of project, testing and preparation for deployment. Defect/bug discovery and acceptance testing for the administration system. Document testing and outcomes and liaise with other departments to ensure tasks and bugs are completed to specifications.


Qualifications



About you:

The successful candidate should be a conscientious individual with exceptional problem-solving skills and a high degree of professional ethics and intellectual curiosity. In addition, the candidate should be a well-rounded individual who possesses the right combination of communication skills, an inquiring mind and creative mindset.

Qualifications and Experience

1-4 years of experience in a financial institution with some data management expertise
Knowledge of insurance industry is a plus
Undergraduate or Graduate degree in business or STEM disciplines
Basic knowledge of audit & quality assurance principles
Interpersonal skills and relationship management
Proficient in SQL, MS Office, Alteryx, and Power BI
Some experience with VBA
Basic French language skills is a plus


Additional Information



PartnerRe provides a working environment in which diversity is valued, where all employees feel welcome, respected, and empowered to perform at their best. We invite you to learn more about D&I at PartnerRe.

Thank you,

PartnerRe Hiring Team

Show more
HTML:
PartnerRe is a leading, privately owned, multi-line global reinsurer with a reputation of financial stability and strength, and a commitment to rebuilding businesses and communities after risk events around the world.

Our mission is to continue to be a financially stable and predictable business partner, supporting our clients with solutions tailored to their needs, delivering superior returns to our owner, providing rewarding opportunities for our people and making a positive contribution to society. To achieve this, we live by our values of Integrity, Performance, Collaboration, Straightforward Communication and Respect and Care.

Core to The PartnerRe Experience is our global nature. No matter where you sit in the company, you are part of something bigger. Our teams represent our truly international mindset, forging connections across office locations and all levels of the organization and building a network of mutual success. The result is a day-to-day experience that will allow you to:

Shape your own career

Grow in a supportive environment

Connect with a community of experts

Make an impact

View Home - PartnerRe Experience e-book to find out more about what it‚Äôs like to work at PartnerRe.

We are always looking for bright, proactive individuals to join our team!

Please follow our Careers page for all updates on new positions. We look forward to receiving your application.

PartnerRe is an equal opportunities employer.

Please join our company LinkedIn Page for all updates on new positions that are coming live.

Job Description

About this job:

The Business Data Analyst will be responsible for the analysis and validation of data files for processing in PartnerRe systems. Data may come in various file formats but usually includes transaction, in force, valuation and underwriting files, which have process streams that vary by function.

  • Participate in client visits or client audits (desk or on-site).
  • Provide support during internal/external audits.
  • Ensure monthly data loads continue to meet stated metrics. Responsibilities include data/plan mapping (including entry and verification of manual data loads) for all clients, investigation and resolution of client issues, and accounting loads/verification.
  • Develop a robust understanding of reinsurance concepts, principles and treaty language.
  • Respond to ad-hoc reporting requests from internal stakeholders.
  • Identify opportunities for process improvement, initiate internal reports and create efficiencies to improve data quality.
  • Assist other teams within North American Life Operations and Administration when necessary.
  • Assist internal stakeholders with requests for data, data inquiries, analyze any data discrepancies with supporting documentation.
  • Analyze and design management reporting as defined by management.
  • Write VBA code, macros, and SQL queries to extract, manipulate, and distribute data.
  • Communicate with clients to facilitate transmission of monthly data files and address any questions/clarifications regarding data issues with clients.
  • Verify that premiums, allowances and taxes for client policies being assumed are being calculated and billed correctly.
  • Update accounting system with monthly client cashflow accounts vs accounts receivable. Find and correct any discrepancies.
  • Adhere to all IT controls and security established by IT management.
  • Adhere to all SOX controls as defined by Internal Control Framework
  • Create and maintain a rigorous and effective control environment. This includes complying with all existing controls and identifying and remediating gaps in our current controls.
  • Follow IT change management process by thoroughly testing all ETL scripts and CRM applications prior to changes to be implemented.
  • Liaise with Underwriting for data checking, management reporting, and discussion on results from Audits and for Retro business (including facultative applications).
  • Assist with Enhancement Projects including creation of project, testing and preparation for deployment. Defect/bug discovery and acceptance testing for the administration system. Document testing and outcomes and liaise with other departments to ensure tasks and bugs are completed to specifications.

Qualifications

About you:

The successful candidate should be a conscientious individual with exceptional problem-solving skills and a high degree of professional ethics and intellectual curiosity. In addition, the candidate should be a well-rounded individual who possesses the right combination of communication skills, an inquiring mind and creative mindset.

Qualifications and Experience

  • 1-4 years of experience in a financial institution with some data management expertise
  • Knowledge of insurance industry is a plus
  • Undergraduate or Graduate degree in business or STEM disciplines
  • Basic knowledge of audit & quality assurance principles
  • Interpersonal skills and relationship management
  • Proficient in SQL, MS Office, Alteryx, and Power BI
  • Some experience with VBA
  • Basic French language skills is a plus

Additional Information

PartnerRe provides a working environment in which diversity is valued, where all employees feel welcome, respected, and empowered to perform at their best. We invite you to learn more about D&I at PartnerRe.

Thank you,

PartnerRe Hiring Team

Title: Senior Game Data Analyst
Description:
Why PlayStation?

PlayStation isn‚Äôt just the Best Place to Play ‚Äî it‚Äôs also the Best Place to Work. Today, we‚Äôre recognized as a global leader in entertainment producing The PlayStation family of products and services including PlayStation¬Æ5, PlayStation¬Æ4, PlayStation¬ÆVR, PlayStation¬ÆPlus, acclaimed PlayStation software titles from PlayStation Studios, and more.

PlayStation also strives to create an inclusive environment that empowers employees and embraces diversity. We welcome and encourage everyone who has a passion and curiosity for innovation, technology, and play to explore our open positions and join our growing global team.

The PlayStation brand falls under Sony Interactive Entertainment, a wholly-owned subsidiary of Sony Corporation.

Role can be based anywhere in Canada

Department overview:

In Game Analytics, we work with some of the best game studios in the world -- responsible for developing some of the most recognisable and ambitious console games and franchises on PlayStation, including Uncharted, The Last of Us, Horizon, God of War, and Gran Turismo.

We provide end-to-end analytics services for PlayStation Studios and use data to help them make their amazing games even better. We seek dedicated people to join us in pushing the boundaries of game analytics for PlayStation.

What you will be doing:

As a Senior Game Data Analyst, you will be working in our cross-disciplinary team to help game studios use data efficiently to improve games. You will work with decision-makers to understand their goals, find opportunities, and guide decisions about features and games across the company. Your responsibilities will include:


Analysing data to deliver high quality insights that contribute to game improvements and drive revenue growth.
Collaborating with stakeholders to drive insightful data-informed conversations, spanning from initial business discussions to successful delivery.
Understanding project requirements, defining KPIs and standard metrics, and recommending robust telemetry design.
Overseeing data quality to ensure accuracy and reliability in reporting and analysis.


What we are looking for:


Advanced SQL knowledge, with a proven track record of applying these skills to analyse complex customer behaviour datasets.
Analytical skills to produce data-backed insights that help improve game design, including experience using statistics, probability, or other quantitative methods.
Experience in driving conversations with a large spectrum of stakeholders, translating sometimes fuzzy business needs into technical requirements, and delivering effective solutions.
In-depth knowledge of the gaming industry, including the realm of live service games.
Experience working with data visualisation tools, such as Looker or Tableau.
Strong presentation skills with the ability to create compelling and engaging presentations.
Experience using and designing game telemetry with AAA or large mobile games.


Bonus points if you have:


A knack for trying and learning new things.
Experience in Python, Jupyter notebooks, R, or machine learning.


‚ÄúPlease refer to our Candidate Privacy Notice for more information about how we process your personal information, and your data protection rights‚Äù

Equal Opportunity Statement:

Sony is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All persons will receive consideration for employment without regard to gender (including gender identity, gender expression and gender reassignment), race (including colour, nationality, ethnic or national origin), religion or belief, marital or civil partnership status, disability, age, sexual orientation, pregnancy or maternity, trade union membership or membership in any other legally protected category.

We strive to create an inclusive environment, empower employees and embrace diversity. We encourage everyone to respond.

PlayStation is a Fair Chance employer and qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records will be considered for employment.

Title: Staff Consultant Analysis & Insights
Description:
Company Description

Merkle | Cardinal Path empowers brands to harness their data and activate against it in pursuit of their business goals. Our passionate experts act as an extension of our clients' teams, leveraging their deep knowledge to help brands maximize media and technology on the path toward digital transformation.

Job Description

This role is remote-friendly: Toronto or Vancouver preferred

The Staff Consultant role at Cardinal Path is designed for people who have some exposure to digital analysis or digital business intelligence but really want to grow existing skills and learn new skills. Areas of growth include (but are not limited to) data visualization, data science, customer analysis, and testing strategies. If this is the right role for you, then read on.

You are a natural problem solver and a quick learner. You enjoy working with data because it's like a mystery to be solved. You do not give up easily and you know how to separate the signal from the noise. You also enjoy working with people because you can both listen and translate data into meaningful business actions. You are not afraid to re-work a hypothesis. You finding those actionable insights that make clients want to keep coming back to you.

In this role, you will have the opportunity to work with industry thought leaders and world class clients. We will teach you our analytic methodologies which will be executed through both automated reporting and ongoing analysis.

Duties & Responsibilities


You will document and critically assess the client's business and analysis questions; develop complex metric guides to answer these client queries
You will grow positive client relationships and trust through strong work and timely responsivity
Understand the infrastructure whereby data is collected, either on a website or via media tools; use debugging tools regularly
You will lead data pull methodology from various web analytics and media analytics tools
You will develop visuals to explain data trends, either via dashboarding or data visualization tools
You will provide deep analysis of data; extract & communicate a 'data story', inclusive of visuals, to answer the client's business needs
You will develop clear, effective, on-the-fly communications in response to client queries
You will manage multiple tasks across multiple projects in a timely manner


This role reports to a Manager.

Qualifications


Bachelor's degree (quantitative field preferred)
2+ years of business analysis focusing on performance optimization
2+ years of continuous work with digital analysis tools, such as Google Analytics or Adobe Analytics
Excellent communication skills including verbal, written and data visualization
Very strong skills in Excel and PowerPoint


Additional Information

The salary range for this position is $60,000-$75,000. Actual salary within the salary range will be based on a variety of factors including relevant experience. A range of medical, dental, RRSP, paid time off, and other benefits also are available to all permanent employees.

We know through experience that different perspectives and backgrounds foster a stronger and more creative work environment that delivers better results. We aim to create workplaces that reflect the clients we serve and where everyone feels empowered to bring their full, authentic selves to work.

We are committed to working‚ÄØwith our candidates from all ability levels throughout the recruitment process to ensure that they have what they need to be at their best. If you need accommodation during the application or interview process, please contact canada.recruitment@dentsu.com or to begin a conversation about your individual accessibility needs throughout the hiring process.
